Title: SYMBA project: innovative industrial symbiosis in the bio-based industrial ecosystem
Description: The SYMBA project (Securing Local Supply Chains via the Development of New Methods to Assess the Circularity and Symbiosis of the Bio-based Industrial Ecosystem) will help deliver bio-based solutions with reduced environmental impacts on soil, water and air quality.The project aims to achieve this by creating an innovative method of industrial symbiosis which can be replicated across the EU, geared to the local/regional bio-based industrial ecosystem. This method will be used to help design zero-waste value chains.
Key Area: Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Digital solutions, Industrial symbiosis, Research

Title: SURFTOP Project: facilitating the use of recycled and renewable materials in the automotive sector
Description: Increasingly, plastic components are being used in vehicles rather than metal ones, as plastic is lighter. The automotive industry is gradually stepping up the percentage of recycled plastic to reduce its environmental impact.AIMPLAS, the Plastics Technology Centre, is a non-profit research association active in the plastics industry. It has launched the SURFTOP Project to develop the use of recycled plastic in vehicle parts.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Recycling, Research, Reuse

Title: Corbion AlgaPrime™ DHA for feed and food: a sustainable and circular option in nutrients production
Description: The Dutch company Corbion grows microalgae in closed fermentation tanks where they transform sustainable sugars into algae in a few days. The algae are then used to produce omega-3 DHA (docosahexaenoic acid). These fatty acids provide essential nutrients for humans and many animal diets.The production system is fully circular.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Energy and waste-to-energy, Food, water and nutrients

Title: FOODY EU: using circular and sustainable food practices to unlock NEET youth's entrepreneurial skills
Description: The FOODY EU project promotes entrepreneurial skills and employment of young people, using circular economy principles to combat unemployment. It provides comprehensive information on the management and environmental impacts of food waste, using the food industry and waste management sector to instill in young people the value of resource conservation.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Food, water and nutrients, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Just Go Zero: how the Greek island of Tilos became a certified 'Zero Waste' City
Description: Tilos is a tiny Greek island, and in 2021 it undertook to become 'zero waste'. And it succeeded: in 2023, it was officially proclaimed a Zero Waste Certified City.They achieved this by setting up the Just Go Zero Tilos project, in collaboration with Polygreen, a waste management company which provides solutions for industrial waste and marine pollution. The project successfuly minimised waste production and cut out landfilling.
Sector: Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Circular action for climate neutrality, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: BUILD-LIMONENE: making construction materials from industrial CO2 emissions and citrus peels
Description: The BUILD-LIMONENE initiative is working on additives and biodegradable materials with a lower carbon footprint that can be used in the construction industry and become viable alternatives to the fossil-based materials currently available.This new technology will contribute to the recovery of waste by using citrus peels and CO2emissions.
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Industrial techniques, Innovation and investment, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Research

Title: Sustainable Estimatics: enabling insurers to track the emissions produced by car insurance claims
Description: Sustainable Estimaticsis a carbon tracking tool,  intended to help the insurance industry manage new environmental, social and governance (ESG) regulations and become greener and less wasteful.It empowers insurers to quantify and mitigate the carbon dioxide equivalent emissions associated with their entire car insurance claims process. As regards the circular dimension, it enables insurers to compare the environmental impact of repairing car parts versus replacing them.
Sector: B2B services, Batteries and Vehicles, Circular action for climate neutrality, Digital solutions, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: JC-Electronics: a global actor in refurbished industrial electronics
Description: From its base in the northern Netherlands, JC-Electronics supplies new, refurbished and repaired industrial electronics. By giving used and defective devices a second life, the company contributes to the circular economy and helps customers reduce their carbon footprint.
Sector: Education and skills, Electronics and ICT, Industrial techniques, Machinery and Equipment, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: BIOBUILD: bio-based solutions to bolster the energy efficiency of buildings
Description: BIOBUILD, a Horizon Europe-funded innovation project, has been launched with a €4.9 million budget to provide thermal solutions for energy efficient buildings using fully bio-based building materials.The project incorporates bio-based phase change materials (bioPCMs) into solid wood and fibres bound by plant oil resins, lignin and fungal mycelium. BIOBUILD aims to reduce the energy consumption of buildings by up to 20%.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Housing and Urban development, Recycling

Title: RECIMAP project: recycling blended cotton and polyester fabric waste
Description: The RECIMAP project aims to recycle blended cotton and polyester fabric waste, thus contributing to the circular economy in the textile industry.Recovering this waste will make it possible to obtain recycled polyester and lactic acid, both in high demand on the market. Lactic acid is an essential component for the production of polylactic acid (PLA).
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Industrial techniques, Recycling, Research, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: The EDUCIRC project: The circular economy as a development model for the Republic of Serbia
Description: The transition towards the circular economy entails complex economic and social changes. Using a survey, the EDUCIRC project will provide policy recommendations on rural development, with particular emphasis on women and young people.It will devise a new methodology for assessing the capacity of rural areas to deliver this transition and identify the main obstacles, strengths and problems, as well as possible solutions.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Governance, Measuring circularity, Research

Title: e-SAFE: tackling the need to renovate the EU's housing stock
Description: Recognising the need for a more circular construction sector, the Horizon 2020 e-SAFE project is trying to change the way we approach building retrofitting, enhancing the overall longevity of existing structures.
Sector: Circular design, Housing and Urban development, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Dutch Register of Electronic Equipment Repairers
Description: The online national Register of Electronic Equipment Repairers (Nationaal Reparateursregister) has been launched in the Netherlands. It enables consumers and (retail) professionals to find professional and skilled independent repairers and refurbishers of electronic equipment who work nearby.
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Circular action for climate neutrality, Digital solutions, Electronics and ICT, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Green Deal Circular Festivals: striving for a circular and climate neutral festival industry
Description: As a growing community of European frontrunner festivals, Green Deal Circular Festivals strives for fully circular and climate neutral festivals, as festivals can play a guiding role in inspiring a green movement and accelerate society’s transition.
Sector: Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Circular design, Culture, Sports and Leisure activities, Energy and waste-to-energy, Measuring circularity, Power and utilities, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Reuse, Social impact, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: KOMA Modular: Modular buildings which follow the Build, Refurbish, Dismantle, Rebuild concept
Description: The Czech company KOMA Modular s.r.o. is taking a new approach to construction: it manufactures modular buildings made up of individual prefabricated units. It's an effective method which avoids the whole material-intensive issue of construction and demolition.
Sector: Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Industrial techniques

Title: Sensoneo, smart and cost-effective waste management solutions from Slovakia
Description: Sensoneo provides smart waste management solutions that support the digital transformation of waste management to achieve efficiency, transparency, and sustainability.The company is specialised in digitisation and streamlining of waste collection.
Key Area: Consumption, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Gees Recycling: traceability of products made from fibre-reinforced composites
Description: Gees Recycling's "Retracking" project aims to help lay the groundwork for moving the fibreglass manufacturing sector from a linear to a circular economy by proposing a circular model able to produce a secondary raw material from fibre-reinforced composite waste.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Industrial techniques, Recycling, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Gruppo FOS: A Repair Centre to curb electronic waste
Description: Reliance on electronics comes with steep environmental costs, from mining minerals to disposal of end-of-life devices. As the use of electronic products has grown, their average lifespan becomes shorter. This in turn results in an increased volume of discarded and obsolete electronic devices.Gruppo FOS in Caserta (Italy) provides a T&G (technology and groupware) Repair Centre and Swap & Repair services for electronic devices.
Sector: Electronics and ICT, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: FOOD-Y: giving NEETS skills and combating food waste
Description: FOOD-Y, an Erasmus+ Cooperation partnership in youth, brings together partners from five countries to combat food waste while equipping NEETs with valuable skills.The programme aims to give young people who are neither in employment nor in education and training (NEET) the information they need to devise innovative solutions to food waste. The young people gain the skills and confidence to make them employable while coming up with innovative ways to get the local community involved in combating food waste: a win-win proposal!
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Awareness raising, Education and skills, Food, water and nutrients, Social impact, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Swapp! - Buy the amount you actually need, in a reusable container
Description: The Polish company Swapp! aims to encourage consumers to act sustainably by urging them to opt for reusable containers when they go shopping.
Sector: Electronics and ICT

Title: Circularity in the automotive industry: Stellantis has made circularity part of its business model
Description: With 14 automotive brands around the globe, Stellantis is a major industry player. In March 2022, it presented its Dare Forward 2030 strategic plan, aiming to achieve carbon net zero by 2038 while reducing its consumption of natural resources. The plan is steered by the Circular Economy Business Unit and is based on remanufacture, repair, reuse and recycle.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Circular design, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Eco Repair ScoreⓇ: a solution for informed and environmentally friendly vehicle repair choices
Description: Eco Repair Score NV and VITO have developed the Eco Repair Score® to assess the environmental impact of a specific car repair job. It does this using a single score, with categories from A to E and associated colour coding.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Circular action for climate neutrality, Corporate Procurement, Digital solutions, Empowering Consumers, Industrial techniques, Measuring circularity, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: CuCilento: turning by-products into shopping bags
Description: CuCilento (which can be understand to mean both "Sew slowly" and "Sew in Cilento", a region in Campania) is an innovative business project designed by Sarah Khoudja as part of the EU's 'Empowering Women in Agrifood' programme led by the Future Food Institute. It is an upcycling workshop which processes agricultural by-products and other materials (boat sails, factory scraps, etc.) classified as waste and turns them into net or fabric bags that can be used for food packaging or shopping.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Retail, Reuse, Social Enterprise, Social impact

Title: BRILIAN: Promoting the transition to bio-based economies in rural areas
Description: The BRILIAN project is designed to support the adoption of sustainable and cooperative business models in rural areas, enabling a smoother transition to bio-based economies. It plays a fundamental role in revitalising these regions and promoting sustainable economic and social development by transforming primary producers into active players in the supply chain, aligned with the goals outlined in the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP), the Green Deal and the European Bioeconomy Strategy.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: RCA Engineering: Recycling composite materials in a circular plant
Description: RCA Engineering has come up with modular plants for recycling composite materials. The modular engineering and construction process produces plants that can be assembled quickly and affordably.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Industrial techniques, Machinery and Equipment, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: DiCE - Digital Health in the Circular Economy
Description: DiCE (Digital Health in the Circular Economy) has been created to bring key stakeholders together to address challenges associated with the growing use of digital healthcare products and increasing demand for raw materials to manufacture new electronic devices and other equipment.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Circular design, Health and healthcare, Recycling, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: RecycAI: recovering fabric waste to make heavy-duty bags
Description: The Albanian social enterprise RecycAl reuses textile waste such as leather or canvas by turning it into heavy-duty bags that could be produced at industrial scale.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Gravity Wave: From ocean plastic to furniture and recycled raw materials
Description: Gravity Wave is a social start-up based in Spain. It focuses on working with small-scale fishermen to collect as much as possible of the plastic waste fouling the Mediterranean, from water bottles to a whole load of discarded fishing nets.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Awareness raising, B2B services, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Knof Institute for Creative Development - a social enterprise
Description: Knof is a Slovenian social enterprise with a focus on circularity and sustainability. It operates reuse boutiques, a circular laboratory and a programme for individuals and entrepreneurs supporting sustainable companies.
Sector: Awareness raising, B2B services, Circular design, Clothing and Fashion industry, Furniture, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Arteinborsa: upcycling old banners into fashion accessories, with a hint of history and culture
Description: Parma Municipality, theConfederazione Nazionale dell’Artigianato e della Piccola e Media Impresa(National Confederation of Crafts and SMEs) andLa coperta di Linushave launched a project calledArteinborsa(A-Bag-from-Art). This project uses old posters from local exhibitions to create bags and accessories.
Sector: Circular design

Title: MixMatters: Smart and flexible separation and valorisation of mixed bio-waste from the agri-food value chain
Description: The MixMatters project aims to optimise the value derived from mixed biological waste. It will introduce a groundbreaking, integrated and adaptable solution for efficiently harnessing the potential of mixed bio-waste.
Sector: Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Circular action for climate neutrality, Industrial techniques, Innovation and investment, Machinery and Equipment, Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling, Research, Social impact, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: WREP scheme: Pilot project for recycling post-consumer PVC articles
Description: The "Waste REcycling Project" (WREP) is a pilot scheme developed by PVC Forum Italia, the national association of producers, converters and recyclers of PVC (polyvinyl chloride), in collaboration with VinylPlus, the European PVC value chain association.It aims to make the collection, sorting and recycling of PVC waste from demolition/renovation, bulky waste and waste management centres more efficient, using a consolidated and accredited traceability methodology.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: ELLIPSE: Efficient and novel reuse of organic waste streams
Description: The ELLIPSE project seeks to optimise the use of two heterogeneous waste streams of which plentiful amounts are generated across Europe:slaughterhouse waste (bellygrass)andpaper and pulp sludge. The project will produce cost-efficient polyhydroxyalkanoates(PHAs)for the agricultural and packaging sectors by co-processing these waste streams with other organic ones such as glycerol from the biodiesel industry and sludge from the dairy industry.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Awareness raising, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Packaging, Personal and household goods, Recover, Regenerative economy, Research

Title: Skanska and Cyrkl join forces to endeavour to recover 96% of materials from the Merkuria building in Prague
Description: Skanska is a leading construction and development company that has made sustainability a crucial part of its operations. With the assistance of Cyrkl, it has taken on the challenge of deconstructing the Merkuria building, revolutionising the industry, saving materials and helping charities in the process.
Sector: Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: ReLearn: artificial intelligence helping organisations to improve recycling rates
Description: ReLearn is an innovative start-up using Artificial Intelligence to help companies and municipalities increase their recycling rates.
Sector: Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Innovation and investment, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: CircEUlar: understanding the dynamics and levers for societal transformation towards a net-zero emission circular economy
Description: CircEUlar is a four-year European Research and Innovation Action that will develop new modelling approaches for analysing circularity from a systems perspective.
Organisation: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Circular action for climate neutrality, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Research, Social impact, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Siptex: A pioneering textile sorting technology for increased circularity
Description: Siptex is the world’s first large-scale facility for sorting textiles by colour and fibre composition through near-infrared light to handle large flows and produce textile fractions suited to different recycling processes.  As textile waste is a growing concern around the world, innovative solutions are required to tackle this environmental problem.
Sector: Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Jeanologia: denim garments with a close-to-zero water and chemicals footprint
Description: The Spanish company Jeanologia is currently spearheading the greatest challenge facing the textile industry: to achieve total dehydration and detoxification in denim industry. With Mission Zero the company is transforming the way jeans are made, from fabric to finish, minimising the use of water and chemicals to a close-to-zero target.
Sector: Chemical management, Clothing and Fashion industry, Industrial techniques, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Textiles, apparel and leather, Water

Title: A Digital Environmental Label for proper disposal of packaging waste
Description: EAD is a digital environmental label providing information about the product's packaging: its components, the materials it's made of, and how to dispose of them properly.All you need to do is scan the QR code on the packaging to get real-time, geolocated and accurate information on how to dispose of it.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Digital solutions, Empowering Consumers, Packaging, Recycling

Title: Arany Kapu: valorising winemaking byproducts from nearly 300 Hungarian vineyards
Description: Arany Kapu (in English "golden gate"), a private company in Kunfehértó, Hungary, collects grape processing and winemaking byproducts from all the country's wine regions for valorisation in diverse forms, including distillation.
Sector: Other (viticultural distillery)

Title: Hydal Coffee: cascade recycling of spent coffee grounds and coffee capsules
Description: Hydal Coffee has adopted a unique cascade recycling system for used coffee grounds which is in line with the zero waste concept. In this way, they support the circular economy and thus mitigate the impact on climate change.Through this system, Hydal Coffee obtains high-quality ingredients by gradually removing the valuable parts of coffee grounds. These are then used in the cosmetics industry and serve as an input material for making plastic products.
Sector: Recycling

Title: REEPRODUCE: Dismantling and recycling rare earth elements from end-of-life products for the European green transition
Description: The REEPRODUCE project will break new ground by establishing a sustainable and complete European industrial-scale value chain for recycling the rare earth elements in permanent magnets. REEPRODUCE will capitalise on the knowledge generated by previous R&D projects (REE4EU) and tackle all the remaining technical challenges along the value chain. This innovative technique will produce new permanent magnets using environmentally-friendly technologies at a competitive cost and using end-of-life products as a resource.
Sector: Awareness raising, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Recycling, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Social impact, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Re:Lab AB: converting research lab plastic consumables into carbon monoxide and hydrogen
Description: The Swedish company Re:Lab AB has developed a chemical circular economy solution to convert plastic items used in research laboratories into a syngas comprised of carbon monoxide and hydrogen. These two components are in high demand for the production of chemicals and plastics.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Research

Title: AIMPLAS developing a method for converting marine plastic waste into aquaculture products
Description: The ÑCostas project will make it possible to reuse plastic material recovered from the sea and waste from the aquaculture industry to make walkways and platforms for fish farms, port protection products, flotation tubes, and nets and mesh for reinforcement, among other products.
Sector: N/A

Title: COAG: composting in Catalonia
Description: 150 livestock family farms have joined a bio-economy plant project in Alcarràs, Catalonia, a region with many livestock farms and fruit plantations. The project aims to manage manure in a more sustainable and circular way.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry

Title: tExtended: an innovative approach to recycling textiles waste
Description: The tExtended European project has come up with an innovative approach to recycling textile waste by developing a knowledge-based masterplan for optimised recycling of discarded textiles. The research combines recycling, waste-valorisation and data technologies to maximise the impact.Twenty organisations from 10 countries have collaborated to create economically feasible and sustainable solutions for reducing waste in the textiles industry.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: H2020 project PEACOC
Description: PEACOC is a pre-commercial H2020 pilot project for the efficient recovery of precious metals from European end of life resources with novel low-cost technologies.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Recycling, Research, Reuse, Social impact, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Upcycle your office with IMPACT Furniture
Description: https://www.instagram.com/impact.furnitureIMPACT Furniture is part of Oxfam Belgium. Through its Upcycle Your Office project, it is in the process of developing a catalogue of upcycled office furniture.The plywood panels are recovered from old office furniture thrown away by local businesses and organisations and subsequently used as a raw material for making new furniture items.The profits are ploughed back into Oxfam Belgium and help finance projects to fight poverty.
Sector: B2B services, Furniture, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: 2022 Edition of the Circular Navarre Catalogue
Description: The Circular Navarre Catalogue 2022 is an update of the showcasing booklet published in 2020 and in 2021. This new edition includes 50 organisations - based on circular business models - in the Spanish Navarre region, looking for international cooperation.
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Awareness raising, Batteries and Vehicles, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Circular design, Clothing and Fashion industry, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Digital solutions, Electronics and ICT, Food, water and nutrients, Furniture, Machinery and Equipment, Mobility and transport, Packaging, Recycling, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Reuse, Soils, soil improvement and restoration, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Blue Plastics - a Dutch innovation for recycling flexible plastics
Description: Blue Plastics technology, called CleanBlueTech, is a pioneering, solvent-based, closed-loop washing technology that removes smell, glue, print-ink and organic residues from any plastic flexible film waste.CleanBlueTech is a game changer as it uses 70% less energy and 100% less water than existing technologies.
Sector: Circular design, Economic instruments, Industrial techniques, Innovation and investment, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Claerhout Aluminium or how to make roofing circular
Description: The roofing clips by Claerhout Aluminium are an aluminium roof trim enabling the circular finishing of a flat roof with bitumen.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Mining, metals and minerals

Title: IOBAC: adhesive-free flooring tiles which can be readily reused and recycled
Description: IOBAC avoids adhesive and attaches its flooring materials partly by means of magnets. Its Dual-Grip technology affixes flooring using both magnetism and tack. This means that tiles can be taken up and reused, keeping the components in the value chain, or recycled. The technology is manufactured using plant-based VOC-free resins, recycled rubber tyres and additives from scrap iron.
Sector: Circular design, Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Hutoepito: upcycling closed-cell rigid polyurethane foams
Description: The Hungarian Ministry of Finance has approved a HUF 197.85 million non-refundable grant for Hutoepito, the parent company of KleanLabs, in order to fund research, development and innovation activities under theUpcycling of closed-cell rigid polyurethane foamsproject, which will run until 31 January 2025.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: A new life for used or broken skateboards makes the rides more sustainable and supports the local community
Description: The Lithuanian Commune DIY, a team of skateboarding professionals and enthusiasts, collects old, broken Canadian maple hardwood skateboards that have lost their original purpose and recycles them 100 %. The new products made of skateboards are sustainable, strong and have a new life span which is longer than the one of an average skateboard deck.
Sector: Recycling

Title: Tarkett pioneers the Material and Product Passport concept with the Material Health Statement
Description: Tarkett has launched an independently verified (by EPEA), science-based declaration highlighting thehealth hazards and risks of materialsin a particular product. By introducing thisMaterial Health Statement (MHS), Tarkett completes the environmental data provided by the Environmental Product Declaration (EPD) and complements its indicators.
Sector: Chemical management, Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure

Title: Tarkett and Aquafil are closing the loop on carpet tiles
Description: Tarkett has developed a technology at its Dutch Waalwijk carpet production facility enabling the separation of the two principal components of carpet tiles. Its recycling centre creates two streams of materials that can be recycled and transformed into high-quality resources for new products.
Sector: B2B services, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Circular flooring partnership by Tarkett & IKEA
Description: Tarkett is pioneering post-use flooring recycling in Europe. It is working with IKEA to transform used Tarkett flooring from the IKEA Kungens Kurva store into new flooring.
Sector: B2B services, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Recycling, Retail

Title: Ragn-Sells and Tarkett are developing carbon negative circular raw materials from waste
Description: Tarkett is working with the Swedish environmental companyRagn-Sellsto develop carbon negative mineral fillers for vinyl flooring by 2025, using Estonian oil shale ash.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Recycling

Title: The reusable Ocean Package for e-commerce
Description: The Ocean Package UG is a young and sustainable company from Munich with the goal to make e-commerce more environmentally friendly and sustainable. For this purpose, they have designed reusable packaging made of recycled polypropylene, which contains a proportion of collected plastic from the North Sea. Their product can be used 20 times more often than conventional cardboard packaging.
Sector: B2B services, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Reuse, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: CIMPA: making multilayer plastic films circular
Description: CIMPA, an EU-funded H2020 project, aims to develop a recycling chain for post-industrial and post-consumer multilayer films from food and agricultural applications. This complex approach combines innovative compositional sorting, mechanical and physical recycling and an advanced decontamination process.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Innovation and investment, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: CIRCULAR FoodPack, or how to enable the circular use of plastic packaging for direct food contact
Description: The consortium CIRCULAR FoodPack is working on solutions to enable the circular use of plastic packaging, focusing on the most sensitive product category: food. The project aims to develop recyclable packaging with at least 50% post-consumer recyclates incorporated behind a functional barrier.
Organisation: Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft zur Förderung der angewandten Forschung e.V.
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Circular design, Industrial techniques, Innovation and investment, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: MERLIN: a project increasing the quality and rate of multilayer packaging recycling waste
Description: The MERLIN project (Increasing the quality and rate of MultilayER packaging recycLINg waste) aims at designing innovative solutions for all the processes required to increase the quality and rate of recycled plastic materials coming from multi-layer packaging waste. MERLIN’s new solutions will meet the growing number of plants that are seeking effective solutions.
Sector: Circular design, Food, water and nutrients, Industrial techniques, Innovation and investment, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Coffeefrom: processing coffee grounds into a durable and resistant alternative to single-use plastic
Description: Coffeefrom is an innovative project from Italy, the second circular economy project run byIl Giardinone Cooperativa Sociale. It has built a supply chain based on the recovery and processing of industrial coffee grounds. Coffee grounds from the food industry are blended with biopolymers to become a new bio-based material that is a durable and resistant alternative to single-use plastic.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Food, water and nutrients, Industrial techniques, Personal and household goods, Social impact, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials
Scope: Regional, Cooperation and development, National, EU

Title: RE.WIND: routing used packaging film to a dedicated supply chain that recycles it efficiently
Description: The RE.WIND project routes used film to a dedicated supply chain that allows it to be recycled more efficiently, ensuring that the film obtained is of a high quality. The material goes back to the company in the form of film that can be used again to wrap pallets of goods.
Sector: B2B services, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling

Title: Phosphorus recovery by BioDryer and P-Series pyrolysis from sewage sludge and organic waste
Description: Bioforcetech aims to reduce energy and labour costs while reducing emissions and generating by-products (fertilisers) with added value. The company's vision is simple: instead of transporting "waste", machines are designed to autonomously transform organics into value. Bioforcetech's technology locally transforms organic streams into renewable energy and biochar.

Title: All you need is food: this awareness campaign in Italy promotes circular behaviour to reduce food waste
Description: Food waste causes loss of materials and energy, environmental damage and negative effects on people's health and quality of life. Title: NP-bioTech: catalytic biostabilisation for a fast treatment of citrus pulp or sewage sludge into a rich biofertiliser
Description: NP-bioTech uses a biocatalyst, adsorbed onto an inert material (catalytic substrate). This enables the accelerated fermentation of critical biomass (such as citrus pulp or sewage sludge), transforming it into a biostabilised and pasteurised material with excellent agronomic properties.

Scope: Cities, Regional, Rural, Other (district; productive areas; supply chain), Cooperation and development, National, International, Global, EU

Title: Hydro Ben: recovering oils and fats from wastewater in catering establishments
Description: The Hydro Ben project focuses on resource recovery for reuse in other industrial activities. It consists ofrecovering fatty substancesfrom wastewater in professional catering facilities, by means of a special device which is placed under the sink.

Title: LIFE CIRC-ELV Project: channelling plastic from end-of-life vehicles back into the manufacturing chain
Description: The LIFE CIRC-ELV project has developed a new process for managing end-of-life vehicles to recover bumpers and fuel tanks, recycle the materials and use them to manufacture pipes and new parts for vehicles. Using this recycled plastic in products from this industry and others will help reduce the carbon footprint by 85%.

Description: The EU-funded OLEAF4VALUE project has set up a consortium of highly experienced partners to develop a valorisation system for the olive leaves biomass. Description: The BioSupPack project aims to deliver novel, cost-competitive and versatile bio-based packaging solutions - based on PHA - that demonstrate high-performance for the packaging of food, cosmetics, homecare and beverage products as well as no environmental damage during & after their use.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Circular design, Food, water and nutrients, Industrial techniques, Innovation and investment, Packaging, Personal and household goods, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: More circular, sustainable and profitable mushroom industry by Bioschamp
Description: The Bioschamp project, coordinated by Asochamp, will develop a peat-free casing soil to serve as a carrier for selected bacterial strains that will act as crop biostimulants.This solution will also be an alternative to pesticides, thus contributing to improve the circularity, productivity, sustainability, and profitability of the European mushroom sector.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry

Title: Slow flower: all the beauty of fresh cut flowers, without harmful effects on the environment
Description: The slow flower movement is growing in Europe and aims to provide local, seasonal and organic flowers. Why? Because the international flower industry is very harmful to nature and has major negative impacts in developing countries.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Awareness raising, Circular action for climate neutrality, Empowering Consumers

Description: Under the framework of the INSIGHT project, a Blueprint has been developed to provide specific recommendations on how to promote the application of Industrial Symbiosis and its facilitation to various stakeholders, as well as a roadmap of how the organisations are expected to apply the IS principles, by making use of educational specific inputs and resources.

Title: CISUFLO: minimising the environmental impact of the EU flooring sector
Description: The project, funded under Horizon 2020, aims to develop a systemic circular approach to floor coverings.

Sector: Furniture, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Research, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: ReCreate: Innovate and develop novel technological solutions for deconstruction and reuse
Description: ReCreate pushes towards circular construction by investigating the system changes needed in the whole ecosystems of construction and demolition.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Research, Reuse

Title: Laboratorio Cartiera: leather and a social conscience!
Description: The Italian Cartiera is an ethical fashion workshop founded in Lama di Reno, Marzabotto, in 2017 which makes leather and fabric items.Believing strongly that work is an extraordinary tool for social inclusion, Cartiera offers paths for employment and integration of disadvantaged people, mainly refugees and asylum seekers.

Description: AIMPLAS, the Plastics Technology Centre, has now completed the fourth and final year of the RepescaPlas project. The project has developed a complete management system for plastic waste recovered from the sea and subsequent recycling into products of commercial value.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: A textile evaluation by Clear Fashion: Buying less but better!
Description: Clear Fashion, independant expert of garment evaluation, is a solution that informs consumers on brands' practices and clothes' impact, and enables fashion brands to communicate their scores, in order to bring more transparency in the fashion industry.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Circular action for climate neutrality, Empowering Consumers, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Industrial CO2 emissions transformed into paints, varnishes and adhesives for footwear and furniture
Description: The PUCO2project, led by AIDIMME, AIMPLAS and INESCOP, uses research and development to combat global warming caused by greenhouse gas emissions. Seventeen companies have taken part in the project, which will also be relevant to producers of adhesives for related sectors, as well as the textile, automotive and toy industries.

Sector: B2B services, Chemical management, Circular action for climate neutrality, Industrial techniques, Innovation and investment, Recover, Regenerative economy

Title: Portnet, a blockchain-powered waste management solution for greener, more efficient ports
Description: To solve some challenges in the port environment, Blue Room Innovation is developing a solution based on blockchain technology: PortNet. It is a blockchain-powered waste management solution for greener, more efficient ports. A WastePassport has also been developed that connects waste disposed in port reception facilities to treatment plants.
Sector: Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: RECICLOS: providing incentives for recycling cans and plastic beverage bottles
Description: RECICLOS provides incentives for recycling cans and plastic beverage bottles. Its main objective is to increase and improve recycling of these objects by introducing rewards that motivate people to do so. When people recycle using the RECICLOS app, they receive points that can be exchanged for sustainable prizes or used for local projects.
Sector: Digital solutions, Innovation and investment, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Wegozero: mapping businesses with zero waste potential in Europe
Description: The zero waste consultancy wegozero has mapped more than 1000 businesses with zero waste potential in four European cities. Its maps are available for a monthly subscription and aim to tell people which businesses in their city are sustainable and geared to circular thinking.
Sector: Awareness raising

Title: Innovation in packaging: toilet paper products wrapped in cardboard
Description: The project of LC Paper consists in the migration of all the plastic packaging of paper products (toilet paper, hand towels...) to cardboard packaging and folding.
Sector: Industrial techniques, Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI)

Title: Yuman Village: a circular economy shopping centre in Brussels
Description: Yuman Village is a temple of the circular economy located in Brussels. It offers a unique 'one stop shopping' experience that encourages the emergence of new circular economy models, creates local jobs and reduces the number of trips needed to buy sustainable and local products.
Sector: Awareness raising, Personal and household goods, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Retail

Title: Re4circular: a new AI-based solution to improve the sorting and cataloguing of textile waste
Description: Atelier Riforma started as a social economy startup with a pioneer marketplace for upcycled garments. Realising that the sorting and cataloguing of textile waste were too labour-intensive for industry standards, founders came up with the idea of developing an AI-based automated solution - called Re4circular - to create a digitized and truly efficient post-consumer clothing supply chain.
Key Area: Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: B2B services, Digital solutions, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: AIMPLAS research: thermoplastic composites for vehicle batteries could improve both energy efficiency and recycling rates
Description: The VETERIA21 project, funded by the Valencian Regional Government and implemented by AIMPLAS, will develop new, more efficient transformation processes for thermoplastic composites that can be used to replace the metal content of electric vehicle batteries.These materials ensure a major reduction in vehicle weight, thus extending battery life. They are also easily recyclable.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Agroamb: processing organic waste into fertilisers
Description: Agroamb Prodalt SL is a rural SME working in the primary sector. It provides agricultural services for farmers and organic fertilisers from biodegradable waste generated in the primary and agri-food sectors. Its process sanitises biodegradable waste and animal by-products with lime and produces organic fertilisers (turning these waste materials into resources).
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, B2B services, Circular action for climate neutrality, Soils, soil improvement and restoration, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Wishing to organise an event anywhere in Finland? Rent a tapahtumakärry!

Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Culture, Sports and Leisure activities, Product as a Service, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Description: Ekofungi is a Serbian company that takes a 100% circular approach to mushroom cultivation. It has pioneered a technology for sustainable cultivation of edible mushrooms using recycled cellulose waste. Each year, Ekofungi grows 130 tons of mushrooms which are either sold fresh or dehydrated and mixed with other vegetables.
Sector: Circular design, Food, water and nutrients, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: UPMADE® by Reet Aus turns textile leftovers from cost into value
Description: The mission of Reet Aus is to minimise the ecological footprint of one of the world's most contaminating businesses – the fashion industry. They do it by industrial upcycling. This not-wasteful way of production is based on a scientific methodology called UPMADE® that has been developed by the designer and founder PhD Reet Aus in cooperation with Stockholm Environment Institute Tallinn Center.

Description: The Circular Navarre Catalogue 2021 is an update of the first showcasing booklet published in 2020. This new edition includes 30 organisations - based on circular business models - in the Spanish Navarre region, looking for international cooperation.

Title: A tool-sharing corner of Asikkala municipal library is a significant step towards circularity

Title: Book in Loop, BabyLoop and UniLoop: how to bring circularity to our children's everyday lives
Description: The Loop Company has discovered the opportunities offered by the circular economy and launched three initiatives - Book in Loop, BabyLoop and UniLoop - that bring circularity to everyday life.

Description: C2C ExpoLAB is a consultancy firm which specialises in the practical application of Cradle to Cradle (C2C) principles in the built environment. Title: Schijvens: Circular corporate fashion
Description: Schijvens has been producing corporate uniforms for more than 150 years now. This led to 100% recycled yarn, which is used to make new fabrics and ultimately new uniforms.
Sector: Recycling, Retail, Textiles, apparel and leather

Description: Van Werven Plastics Recyling specialises in creating high-quality raw materials from post-consumer hard plastics, collected from construction waste, industrial waste and municipal recycling centres. Description: Groningen Seaports is the economic operator, developer and port authority for the port of Delfzijl, Eemshaven and adjoining industrial sites. Sector: Industrial techniques, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Interseroh provides reusable plastic boxes for fruit and vegetables sold at Aldi Süd stores
Description: Interseroh provides recycling solutions for plastic packaging. For instance, it has developed a pooling system of reusable plastic boxes for fruit and vegetables sold at Aldi Süd, a German supermarket network.
Sector: Packaging, Recycling

Title: Gr3n: chemical recycling of PET bottles and food containers is now possible at a reasonable cost
Description: TheGr3nprojects aims to contribute to the fight against plastic proliferation in the world by introducing an innovative process for profitable plastic recycling. This process uses microwave technology on a chemical reaction, and results in a ground-breaking, economically efficient chemical recycling process for PET.

Description: Delt Papir is a Croatian manufacturer and supplier of paper products which produces items such as tissue and hygiene products for the consumer and professional care sectors. Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Industrial techniques, Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI)

Title: Community composting in the city of Nitra
Description: As part of the EU's Bioregio project, the Slovakian city of Nitra has developed a project forcommunity composting by 50 households. The system produces compost, which can be used as a fertiliser by the community. The project aims to lower technical barriers to the reduction of bio-waste.

Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Food, water and nutrients, Recycling

Title: The never-ending life cycle of a cotton gauze grocery bag
