Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Innovation and investment, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: E-waste Race: school-based collection of old electronic devices
Description: The E-waste Race is an educational competition between ten primary schools to collect old electronic devices. Project participants are given an introductory lecture about recycling and the valuable materials contained in electronic devices. They then start collecting e-waste and the school which collects the most wins an educational - and fun! - school trip.
Sector: Awareness raising, Electronics and ICT, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Red Orka: a baby romper revolution
Description: Red Orka is a circular babywear brand that aims to do better for people and the planet. Red Orka's product is delivered to people's homes on the basis of a subscription for a fixed amount each month. The baby rompers are made from 100% organic cotton and produced in the most sustainable way possible.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Clothing and Fashion industry, Product as a Service, Reuse

Title: Organic glues and adhesives by Menichetti
Description: The Italian company Menichetti produces organic glues and adhesives intended for sustainable packaging. The raw material is obtained from leather and tanning industry by-products.
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Other (Production of natural adhesives for packaging)

Title: LENA: the fashion library
Description: LENA is the first online and offline fashion library in the Netherlands. It has a system for borrowing clothes and provides an extended wardrobe for every occasion. Their aim is to speed up the fashion industry's transition towards a circular system.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Clothing and Fashion industry, Product as a Service, Reuse

Title: The Waste Transformers: Turning food waste into valuable resources on-site
Description: The Waste Transformers transforms organic (food) waste in an anaerobic digester called a Waste Transformer housed in 20-foot shipping containers into clean energy, water and high-grade fertiliser whilst also upcycling the waste into new raw materials for paper, textiles or soaps. They do this all on-site where the waste is produced. No transport, no CO2.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Energy and waste-to-energy, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Nic&Mic: Upcycling waste while supporting employment
Description: Ocean Sole takes the world's most widely worn shoe, the flip flop, and turns it into art, and the Dutch company Nic&Mic sells it in the Benelux countries. Ocean Sole is Kenya-based and began with the desire to clean up beaches that were heavily polluted with plastic and flip flops. Ocean Sole has grown to employ 90 Kenyans.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Personal and household goods, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: EMMA Safety Footwear: Sustainable safety shoes
Description: Back in 1931, EMMA was founded as a social enterprise for injured workers from the Dutch State Mines. Hence, social entrepreneurship is in the DNA of EMMA Safety Footwear. Today, EMMA still employs about 100 people who need some additional support in the labour market. Making sustainable safety shoes was, therefore, a logical next step in EMMA’s journey towards a positive footprint.
Sector: Circular design, Recycling, Social impact, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Biorizon: the profitable way to bio-aromatics
Description: Biorizon has been co-creating technologies for the production of bio-aromatics at the Green Chemistry Campus in Bergen op Zoom since 2013. Together with industrial partners, Biorizon creates and develops innovative chemical processes for the production of renewable aromatics from residual biomass. Their aim is to enable commercial production of bio-aromatic building blocks by 2025.
Sector: Chemical management, Research

Title: SNEW Telecom – Circular telecoms and IT equipment with a social heart
Description: SNEW has developed a circular system reusing the raw materials in existing equipment. It aims to give business telecoms and IT equipment a second life. Companies which hand over their old ICT equipment get either maintenance for their current equipment or money for the old equipment.
Organisation: SNEW / No Time To Waste B.V.
Sector: Electronics and ICT, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Arapaha: Circular goods made out of advanced bio-based materials
Description: Arapaha is a design company which develops and manufactures sustainable, circular household and sports items and clothing. It focuses on circular processes and uses biobased composites. Goods purchased in their webshop can be returned when no longer needed so that the components can be reused.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Furniture, Personal and household goods

Title: CuRe: Low energy molecular polyester recycling
Description: CuRe has discovered a smarter and scalable technology for creating a fully circular polyester chain. It rejuvenates any type of used polyester by removing the colour and converting it into clear pellets with the same properties as virgin grade polyester.​ In July 2020, a pilot plant in Emmen (Netherlands) was opened for rapid scale-up.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: FIBI-buffer: a sustainable alternative for protecting products during transport
Description: FIBI-buffer is an eco-friendly alternative to Expanded Polystyrene (EPS) or Polyurethane (PU) foam used to protect products during transport. It is a unique and patented product which offers high-quality protection, is universally applicable, is price competitive, can be reused again and again, and is biobased and 100% compostable.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Mobility and transport, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Catalogue of Best Practices in Circular Economy
Description: The Catalogue of Best Practices in Circular Economy identifies good practices carried out in Spain which are transferable and scalable by other stakeholders.
Organisation: Ministry for Ecological Transition and Demographic Challenge
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: N/A

Title: Grover: Reducing e-waste by renting out electronic devices
Description: Grover rents technological items such as smartphones, laptops, virtual reality (VR) gear and wearables to customers on a flexible basis and with full usage rights. Customers can choose how long they want to rent a given product.
Sector: Digital solutions, Electronics and ICT, Personal and household goods, Product as a Service

Title: Tradecowall: Upcycling mixed mineral construction and demolition waste
Description: The cooperative company Tradecowall manages construction and demolition waste in the Belgian Walloon region and comprises a network of companies working with inert waste recycling centres in the region.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Too Good to Go: the global food reduction app
Description: Too Good to Go is an app for reducing food waste. It's operated by a Danish company which seeks to inspire and empower individuals to do something to stop food waste.
Sector: Awareness raising, Circular action for climate neutrality, Food, water and nutrients, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: Green Alley Award: rewarding the most innovative circular start-ups
Description: TheGreen Alley Awardis Europe’s firstprize for start-ups active in the circular economy, launched in 2014 by the Landbell Group.The initiative aims at supporting a climate-neutral circular economy by encouraging and promoting promising business ideas to turn waste into resources and fight the abundance of plastic waste in our economy.
Sector: Awareness raising, Innovation and investment, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Social impact

Title: Effective Recycling Concrete Technology: aggregates from 100% recycled CDW do not compromise on quality
Description: ERC-TECH is a company based in the Czech Republic that provides the construction sector with know-how, licenses and products to reuse 100% of construction and demolition waste inconcrete mixturesand other products suitable for use in various construction activities.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Recycling

Title: With Leef... tableware really does grow on trees
Description: Leef has eliminated plastic waste by producing 100% biodegradable plates from (non-palm oil) palm leaves grown in mixed plantations in Tamil Nadu, India.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Personal and household goods, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: Circular lighting by Signify
Description: Signify was the first lighting company to develop 3D printing of luminaires at scale. As part of its commitment to doubling its positive impact on the environment and society, Signify has committed to doubling its circular revenues to 32% by the end of 2025.
Sector: Circular design, Personal and household goods, Social impact

Title: URBAN WASTE: Reducing municipal waste generated by tourism
Description: The URBAN WASTE project focuses on urban strategies for waste management in tourist cities. It involved stakeholders from 11 pilot areas and studied the challenges inherent in waste management so that appropriate strategies responding to real-world needs can be devised and implemented.
Type of Organisation: Network of local and/or regional authorities
Sector: Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Culture, Sports and Leisure activities, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Varusteleka or how to extend product lifecycle
Description: Varusteleka, a webshop selling military surplus and outdoor gear in Finland, buys back products it has sold to customers and resells them as second-hand products.
Sector: Retail

Title: Feplo: waterproof eco-boards from pressed recycled drinks cartons for use as building material
Description: The Serbian company Feplo manufactures waterproof eco-boards from recycled beverage cartons.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Recycling

Title: Tabor: second-hand market
Description: Tabor is a marketplace initiative introduced in the city of Maribor, Slovenia. Tabor was designed as a second-hand market, where people can participate by selling their goods to others.
Sector: Awareness raising, Public services, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse

Title: SCALITE®: creating interior design applications from fish scales
Description: SCALITE® is a material produced by SCALE and is made completely from fish scales, a by-product of the fishing industry. The material is manufactured in stone-like blocks which are suited to many applications in interior design and decoration for the hospitality and retail sectors, offices and homes.
Sector: Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: RiceRes research project: reusing waste from rice production
Description: The RiceRes research project, launched in 2016 by the CNR (National Research Council) and the Universities of Milan and Pavia and financed by the Cariplo Foundation, aimed to make the most of waste materials from processing Italian rice.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Food, water and nutrients

Title: Remix: Reuse, reduce, remix
Description: Remix is a shop based in Bulgaria, which sells second-hand and outlet clothing online to nine countries.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Reuse, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: GHform: Leasing as a way of extending the life of outdoor furniture
Description: The Danish company GHform produces outdoor furniture and inventory, such as benches, waste bins and street lights. The company is now also offering municipalities the chance to lease its cast iron lamp posts.
Sector: Furniture, Product as a Service, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: FORCE project: Cities Cooperating For Circular Economy
Description: The FORCE project is an EU-funded project seeking to promote the shift towards the circular economy. Running from September 2016 to January 2021, the project identified four main focus areas: plastic waste, wood waste, used electronic and electrical equipment, and food and biowaste.
Type of Organisation: Network of local and/or regional authorities
Sector: Digital solutions, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Grown uses mycelium and agricultural waste to create fully biodegradable and toxic-free alternative to EPS and EPP
Description: Grown is a biotechnology company that has developed an innovative use for mycelium - the network of mushroom roots - as binding agent for agricultural waste to create fully biodegradable and toxic-free packaging or insulation material.
Sector: Innovation and investment, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: RCERO Ljubljana: efficient waste management
Description: The Ljubljana Regional Centre for Waste Management (RCERO Ljubljana) is a national centre for environmentally-friendly waste management in Slovenia.
Sector: Awareness raising, Circular action for climate neutrality, Energy and waste-to-energy, Machinery and Equipment, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: SeRaMCo: recycling CDW into concrete precast products
Description: The Interreg North-West Europe project SeRaMCo (Secondary Raw Material for Concrete Precast Products) focused on researching and promoting the use of secondary raw materials from construction and demolition waste (CDW).
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: MIWA: a closed-circuit packaging loop
Description: MIWA designs and produces genuinely circular packaging for the whole supply chain. It supplies brand owners/producers with smart capsules and retailers with smart dispensers using the service as a product model.
Sector: Packaging, Product as a Service, Reuse

Title: Coolrec: recovering cast iron from washing machines
Description: Coolrec, an electronics goods recycling company, extracts cast iron counterweights from old Miele washing machines to be returned to the factory for recycling.
Sector: Circular design, Machinery and Equipment, Mining, metals and minerals, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Improving biomass production in Latvia
Description: In Latvia, a project developed by the Ministry of Agriculture (in cooperation with private investment) seeks to improve biomass production in the country’s forests.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry

Title: Löfbergs' drive for circular change in the coffee industry
Description: In Sweden, there is an initiative from the coffee roasting sector which aims to eliminate all waste related to coffee cultivation, processing and consumption by the year 2030.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Food, water and nutrients, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: Ligeti Bolt: a packaging-free shop
Description: Ligeti Bolt is a packaging-free grocery shopin Budapest. The shop does not sell any products in plastic wrapping or packaging and so customers buy exactly the amount they need.
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Personal and household goods, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: Buurman: the local hardware store and workshop that teaches you about the value of secondary materials
Description: Buurman is a hardware store and workshop that only uses secondary materials, such as wood from demolition sites and insulation materials, plywood and cables from construction sites in Rotterdam or from exhibitions and festivals.
Sector: Awareness raising, Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Recycling, Reuse, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Borealis: producing renewable polypropylene from renewable propane
Description: Borealis manufactures polypropylene using renewable feedstock provided by Neste. Specifically, Neste produces renewable propane and Borealis converts it to renewable propylene and subsequently to renewable polypropylene.
Sector: Circular design, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: EtMoi works with prisoners to make badge holders, cushions and masks from old ties and scarves
Description: EtMoi@Work is a Belgium-based circular, social, economy project. It consists of the production of a collection of office articles: badge holders, card holders, cushions for office chairs and new masks in silk by local prisoners. It is a circular economy project, since all its productions use recycled conference lanyards, silk ties and scarves that are no longer worn and, if possible, old jewelry.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry

Title: Brens uses scrap iron, crushed concrete and pulverised rubber to build tomorrow's railways
Description: Czech company Brens, which produces rail tracks, tram and railway lines, has turned to production processes using recycled materials.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Recycling

Title: Allgro: turning wastewater into water for their fruit and vegetable cutting business
Description: In May 2019, the Belgium-based fruit and vegetable cutting business Allgro set up its own water plant. The facility turns wastewater into drinking water, thereby slashing the food company’s mains water consumption.
Sector: Reuse, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Veolia and Knauf: transforming glass waste into mineral wool
Description: Veolia and Knauf have established a partnership to collect, process and transform waste glass into mineral wool for use as an insultating material.
Sector: Ceramics and Glass, Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Recycling

Title: La Poubelle: A bank for secondhand goods
Description: Charity shops are the most basic form of circular economy-driven supply chains:people donate unwanted items rather than throwing them away so that they can be put to use by someone else. La Poubelle is a variation on the theme of charity shops: it's a goods bank tailored specifically to the needs of people facing hard times.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Recycling, Reuse, Social impact

Title: ALBA Group: manufacturing plastic from secondary raw materials
Description: ALBA Group is a major company active in recycling, environmental services and the supply of raw materials. It has come up with a method for producing plastic using secondary raw materials.
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Lucirmás: upcycling (empty) wine bottles
Description: Upcycling is a straightforward way to reuse items which would otherwise be considered waste. Lucirmás has found a way to upcycle bottles.
Sector: Ceramics and Glass, Reuse

Title: PeeCycle: making fertiliser from urine
Description: Peecycle aims to reduce the production and import of fertilisers from all over the world while making more efficient use of an inexhaustible source of minerals which is currently viewed as waste: urine!
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Food waste kitchen sink disposers by VA Syd: from waste to biogas
Description: In cooperation with VA Syd, the City of Malmö has established a pilot project in which kitchen waste disposers have been installed as an easy-to-manage method of dealing with food waste.
Sector: Energy and waste-to-energy, Food, water and nutrients, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Envien Group: producing biofuel from crops and used oil
Description: Each of the companies in the Envien Group produces a biofuel component, with waste used for specific purposes, such as manufacturing pelleted animal feed or as a co-substrate for biogas production.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Energy and waste-to-energy, Refineries, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Entocycle: turning insects into protein bars for animals
Description: Entocycle upcycles local food waste to feed black soldier fly larvae, which grow very fast and become protein-rich animal feed.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Food, water and nutrients, Recycling

Title: Ressourcerie Namuroise, a cooperative collecting, recycling and reusing waste
Description: The Ressourcerie Namuroise in Belgium provides collection and processing services for bulky household waste, while also helping people with scant marketable skills to break into the labour market. In 2017, the cooperative established a partnership with Namur's waste management authority, which enabled municipalities to outsource the collection of bulky items with a view to their reuse.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Empowering Consumers, Energy and waste-to-energy, Personal and household goods, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse, Social impact, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Thanks to Eco Veneta, construction and demolition waste goes back to construction sites for a new adventure
Description: Eco Veneta specialises in the collection and recycling of waste from construction and demolition sites in the Italian provinces of Verona, Vicenza, Padova and Rovigo.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Chip[s] Board: making bio-plastics from potato waste
Description: UK-based Chip[s] Board have developed a range of innovative, circular materials from potato waste.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Mapei: recovering unused concrete from mixer lorries
Description: The Italian company Mapei has come up with a product which brings leftover cement in mixer trucks back into the production cycle.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Milan: Collaborating to change local food systems
Description: The Municipality of Milan, with the Cariplo Foundation, has decided to commit to making its food system more equitable and sustainable by adopting its own Food Policy.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Food, water and nutrients, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: Let's fix Czechia: linking people with repair needs to repair shops and handymen
Description: Opravárna operates a web portal putting repair and service businesses in touch with people who need their services. It has also founded the Association Opravme Česko (Let's fix Czechia) in order to to bring together all relevant partners pursuing the same objectives - waste prevention and transition to a circular economy.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse

Title: Carrefour: reusable and recyclable carrier bags made from marine waste
Description: In 2019, Carrefour Belgium introduced a range of reusable and recyclable carrier bags made from marine waste. The retailer collaborated with Seaqual, an organisation that cleans up the oceans and seabed, to source the plastics needed.
Sector: Awareness raising, Circular action for climate neutrality, Retail, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Estonian start-up 3Cular designs: creating 3D objects from sawdust
Description: Estonian start-up 3cular has designed a pioneering way of reusing this sawdust to produce new objects with 3D printing. The desired object is designed using 3D modelling software and then a 3D printer is used to produce the object in layers. The printing ink is a combination of sawdust and a non-toxic binder making it possible to print wooden objects faster and easier preserving the environment.
Sector: Recycling

Title: Veras - multiplatform for clothing reuse and upcycling in Denmark
Description: Based in the Danish capital Copenhagen, Veras operates several initiatives to reduce waste in the fashion sector by making it easy for everyone to swap and sell clothes. Veras is primarily an online webshop shipping to all Europe, where users can send in their own clothes. It also hosts weekly clothing markets for everyone to buy and sell clothing and has a flagship store in Copenhagen.
Key Area: Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Clothing and Fashion industry, Empowering Consumers, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Vanden: combining plastic collection and recycling
Description: Vanden’s plastic recycling plant transforms plastic waste into commodities, ready to be manufactured into something useful again.
Sector: Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Vaia: giving storm-hit trees back their dignity
Description: Italian startup Vaia has developed a passive loudspeaker for smartphones by using - as raw material - exclusively wood brought down by storm Vaia that badly hit the Dolomite mountains in Northern Italy in 2018.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Personal and household goods, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: Recycled and compostable polymer biocomposites by Trifilon
Description: Trifilon Revo uses an existing, consistent source of plastic from a European stream and reinforces it with hemp fibers, thus improving the impact properties of the recycled plastics, which can be used to produce a range of colours and surface finishes, matte or polished.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Billy Tannery makes leather goods from rescued goatskins
Description: Billy Tannery is a micro-tannery helping to create value by reusing goatskins that would otherwise go to waste, to make leather products.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Personal and household goods, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: The Shellworks collective recycles lobster shells into various types of bioplastic
Description: The Shellworks designers’ collective recycles seafood shells to make bioplastic, in order to reduce plastic use and waste.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Ocean Cleanup - From the Great Pacific Garbage Patch to design sunglasses
Description: Ocean Cleanup has launched design sunglasses made from plastic removed from the Great Pacific Garbage Patch.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Scan your rubbish on ECONIT to improve waste management and collection
Description: In 2017 JRK Waste management introduced an intelligent data system (ECONIT) to reduce the high quantities of mixed municipal waste in Czechia. The programme asks residents to scan their rubbish with QR codes. Information on the quantity and types of waste produced is then used by the local waste management agencies to improve collection and recycling rates.
Organisation: JRK Waste Management s. r. o.
Sector: Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Teemill's circular supply chain: from cotton seed to t-shirt, nothing is wasted!
Description: The company Teemill produces t-shirts from organic cotton. They are designed to be sent back to the company when they are worn out.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Clothing and Fashion industry, Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Splosh: Household products in reusable, refillable containers
Description: Splosh sells its range of products – from detergents and fabric softeners to shower gel and hand wash – in bottles that can be refilled from their concentrated refill pouches. Buying refills in these pouches cuts plastic waste by 95%.
Sector: Empowering Consumers, Packaging, Personal and household goods, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Retail

Title: Philips: Recycled plastics for brand-new coffee machines
Description: Since 2010, Philips has been working on introducing recycled plastics into its product portfolio. The baseplate of Senseo Original coffee makers, the company’s most popular model, has been changed to 95% post-consumer recycled plastic.
Sector: Machinery and Equipment, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: SECONTRADE: The B2B platform for secondary raw materials
Description: SECONTRADE is the first and largest European online market for secondary raw materials, launched in Austria in 2018. It digitalises waste management and enables the trade of recycled materials across Europe.
Sector: B2B services, Circular action for climate neutrality, Digital solutions, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Oryzite: reusing rice husks to reduce the use of plastics
Description: Oryzite is a method for incorporating rice husks as a filler in all types of thermoplastics. The company transforms the rice husks into resin, which can then be used to obtain the same volume of injection-moulded plastic using much fewer fossil-fuel-based polymers.
Sector: Innovation and investment, Packaging, Reuse, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Plastic Energy - Recycling plastics that no-one else can
Description: Complementing traditional mechanical recycling efforts, Plastic Energy has developed a patented Thermal Anaerobic Conversion (TAC) technology to convert end-of-life plastic waste into a new feedstock, called TACOIL, that can be used in the manufacturing of virgin-quality plastics suitable for food-grade packaging.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recover, Regenerative economy

Title: ReBlend - a Social enterprise promoting circular economy for textiles
Description: ReBlend develops textiles and textile products made from textiles that otherwise end up in incineration. Textiles made from recycled fibres offer a positive alternative for designers and companies. In collaboration with waste collectors, producers, designers, makers and visionaries, ReBlend organises a full supply chain from start to finish to accelerate a new ecosystem for circular textiles.
Sector: Product as a Service, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Niaga® designs out waste, completely
Description: Niaga®and its partner future-proof everyday products by making sure materials don’t have to end up as waste. Ever. Niaga designs producted to be used again. It makes them healthier and recyclable.
Sector: Digital solutions, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: Staramaki – a straw made naturally from wheat
Description: “Staramaki” is a straw made of wheat. It is produced by a social cooperative KoinSep in Kilkis, northern Greece. The most widely produced local product wheat is used to create a viable eco-friendly alternative to single use plastic straws. At the same time they create employment opportunities and promote social cohesion, as well as local and regional development.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Social Enterprise, Social impact

Title: ČSOB: eco-friendly recycled bank cards
Description: In 2020, the Czech bank ČSOB, in cooperation with IDEMIA, launched an eco-friendly recycled card to reduce the amount of virgin plastic which ends up in rubbish bins. By opting for IDEMIA’s eco-friendly product, ČSOB is the first bank in the Czech Republic to take a significant step towards addressing this ecological burden.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Consulting goes circular with CIRAA
Description: CIRAA is a company active in promoting circular economy principles and helping businesses ensure that their plans and projects abide by those principles.
Sector: Awareness raising, Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Housing and Urban development, Social impact

Title: Transforming an old factory building into a community centre and party venue in Sint-Amands
Description: The Flemish municipality of Sint-Amands has transformed an old shoe factory into the unique and sustainable multifunctional de Nestel community centre where residents and local associations can feel at home.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Culture, Sports and Leisure activities, Public services

Title: RE-sign: today's cities, tomorrow's mines
Description: RE-sign has marketed an app matching up supply and demand for reclaimed construction materials.
Sector: B2B services, Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Reuse, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Chalmers University: a decidedly fishy project
Description: The NoVAqua project found that the countless thousands of litres of waste water thrown away by the fish processing industry was essentially nutritious stock which can be put to better use than just pouring it down the drain...
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Food, water and nutrients

Title: Using horse manure to power horse shows
Description: Finnish energy company Fortum had developed a circular renewable energy service, dubbed HorsePower, that used recycled materials to provide a bedding management service for stable-owners, as well as using manure for energy.
Sector: Energy and waste-to-energy, Recycling

Title: ecoBirdy: Children’s furniture made from recycled plastic toys
Description: EcoBirdy has come up with a way to recycle mixed plastics, and then uses the resulting material to make recyclable children's furniture.
Sector: Personal and household goods, Recycling

Title: Confindustria's circular economy project
Description: Confindustria has developed an initiative which targets opportunities provided by the circular economy model, encourages knowledge-sharing and raises awareness about good practices being implemented in Italy.
Sector: Awareness raising, Circular design, Education and skills

Title: Refind's Battery Refund machine: old batteries in, coupons for new batteries out
Description: Coop Norway, Energizer and Swedish Refind Technologies have come up with a battery refund machine. People can drop off dead household batteries and walk away with coupons to put towards the price of new batteries.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: BIOCOSI: developing BIOdegradable and COmpostable packaging
Description: The Italian project BIOCOSI(BIOdegradable and COmpostable packaging for sustainable, circular and smart industry) has come up with a revolutionary solution to the problem of wastewater in the dairy sector.
Organisation: ENEA - Italian National Agency for New Technologies, Energy and Sustainable Economic Development
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Packaging, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials
Scope: Cooperation and development, National, International, Global, EU

Title: Mater: chairs from spent brewery grain
Description: In Denmark, the interior design company Mater has developed chairs made out of brewery waste. The production method uses plastic waste and the grain left over from beer production at the Danish brewery Carlsberg.
Sector: Furniture, Recycling

Title: Fjällräven up-cycles wool as a by-product of the meat industry
Description: Fjällräven is giving wool waste a second life by using it for innovative purposes, like padding in jackets or backplate in backpacks.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: TAPA: Rubber substitute for sustainable materials in car components
Description: Cikautxo worked with the TAPA (ThermoplAstic fluid handling Pipes for cooling circuits in Automotive sector) project, funded by EIT RawMaterials, to develop new materials for pipes and hoses. They substituted natural rubber with a 100% recyclable thermoplastic material (thermoplastic elastomeric, TPE), using energy-efficient extrusion technology.

Title: SUSTAINair: bringing the aerospace and aviation sectors in line with circular principles
Description: The Horizon 2020 project SUSTAINair was launched recently. It aims toresearch and develop solutions to increase resource efficiency and aircraft performance while cutting down on waste and material costs throughout the aircraft life cycle - what is known as "circular aviation".

Sector: B2B services, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Industrial symbiosis, Industrial techniques, Innovation and investment, Machinery and Equipment, Mobility and transport, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: CLIC: applying circular economy principles to cultural heritage
Description: CLIC trans-disciplinary research project aims to demonstrate that it is economically, socially and environmentally convenient to maintain and/or reuse cultural heritage and landscape.
Sector: Awareness raising, Circular action for climate neutrality, Culture, Sports and Leisure activities

Title: Maersk: designing ships that can be dismantled and reused
Description: Maersk has been developing ways to build recyclable ships that can be dismantled and reused.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Mobility and transport, Recycling

Title: Aerocircular: upcycling end-of-life aircraft parts
Description: Aerocircular provides green, service-only, economical end-of-life aircraft recycling and upcycling services to fleet owners.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Machinery and Equipment, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Description: RiVending is an innovative cycle of recovery and recycling of polystyrene cups, stirrers and PET bottles for vending machines in Italy.

Title: Herning and DFD do their bit to keep useable clothes in use
Description: The partnership between Herning and DFD has led to a new circular business model for the work clothing used by the municipality’s technical operations department.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Clothing and Fashion industry, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: A municipal procurement contract complying with Nordic Eco-label criteria
Description: The Danish State procurement authority has signed an exclusive procurement contract with the furniture brand Duba-B8, whereby all office furniture must be able to be disassembled into parts and reused several times.
Sector: Furniture, Public procurement, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Marealis: peptides harvested from discarded prawn shells help fight high blood pressure
Description: Marealis uses discarded prawn shells from the seafood industry to make a natural supplement that can lower blood pressure.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Research

Title: RecyOuest: How to clean plastic used in farming without water
Description: RecyOuest is a green economy start-up that recycles contaminated filamentary thermoplastics such as agricultural nets and twines.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Purrot: A self-cleaning vibrating Rotor-filter to separate manure or treat waste water
Description: PURROT is a filter  that can mechanically separate organic matter and nutrients from liquid, without using chemicals.
Sector: Electronics and ICT, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Circular Soap in Park Split Hotel, Croatia
Description: The Croatian project titled "Responsible Business for a Clean World" involves collecting unused soap in hotels and sending it to a soap factory, where it is cleaned, sterilised and recycled into new soap products, which are then offered back to customers at the hotel.
Sector: Personal and household goods, Reuse

Title: Purified Metal: Responsible processing of contaminated steel scrap into high-quality raw material
Description: Purified Metal Company can responsibly process contaminated steel scrap into a high-quality raw material.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: ROSi: producing high-purity raw materials from PV waste and promoting a truly circular PV industry
Description: ROSi has developed innovative processes producing high quality recycled materials including silicon and other metals from PV industry production and product waste. The materials are returned to industrial value chains, leading to a circular raw material lifecycle.
Sector: Chemical management, Energy and waste-to-energy, Recover, Regenerative economy

Title: Refarmed: using buildings’ residual heat and biowaste to support rooftop greenhouses
Description: Refarmed uses the concept of ‘building integrated agriculture’. High-impact buildings (meaning they produce a lot of waste and excess heat) are equipped with rooftop greenhouses which turn all that waste into value - to support low-impact food production.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure

Title: ConnectedBin: Artificial intelligence and Internet of Things for smart waste management
Description: ConnectedBin has developed a waste container solution using artificial intelligence to identify waste types and sort them properly. The Internet of Things system reports on waste types and amounts, making waste collection more efficient.
Sector: Digital solutions

Title: Residuos do Nordeste: an education and awareness campaign on the circular economy
Description: Residuos do Nordeste, an intermunicipal waste management company based in North-Eastern Portugal, is running an education and awareness-raising campaign called "Educar para uma Economia Circular" related to the top of the waste management hierarchy: prevention.
Sector: Awareness raising, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Studio Thomas Vailly's flower power: how to make leather and glue from sunflowers
Description: Studio Thomas Vailly's project makes use of what is left of the sunflower crop to produce innovative materials.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Circular design, Personal and household goods, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: TailoredTile reinvents wall decoration
Description: TailoredTile creates decorative tile pieces completely made of recovered plastic. The company also promotes circular economy by accepting used tilegrams in exchange of purchase discounts, as this material can be crushed and shaped more than once.
Sector: Circular design, Personal and household goods, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Sonae Arauco: Sustainable wood-based panels made from wood industry by-products
Description: Sonae Arauco is a wood-based panel producer that contributes to the circular economy through the recovery of wood waste. It has developed a close value chain that reuses and recycles the wood residues generated during the production process.
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: The Manhattan pop-up bistro made from 100% recyclable materials
Description: For New York's design week, NYCxDESIGN in May 2018, the Finnish Cultural Institute in New York invited chefs from the Helsinki-based Restaurant Nolla to bring their zero waste food philosophy to New York. The temporary bistro was built on themes of circular economy, new material innovations and sustainable design.
Organisation: The Finnish Cultural Institute in New York
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Recycling, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: eCO2blocks: making construction materials from industrial waste, water not fit for drinking and CO2
Description: eCO2blocks creates an alternative – or a complementary material – to cement by producing building blocks made from industrial waste and water which is not fit for drinking.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Da Vide: reducing CO2 emissions when producing paper, paints and pens from by-products of grapevines
Description: In the Douro Valley of Portugal, the research and development project Da Vide has created a range of products using grapevine residues – from paper to pens – avoiding the use of plastics and wood and using agricultural waste as a resource.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Personal and household goods, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: University of Coimbra: using natural flocculants from waste eucalyptus wood to treat wastewater
Description: A team of researchers from the Faculty of Science and Technology of theUniversity of Coimbra(FCTUC) has developed an innovative wastewater treatment technique using natural flocculants extracted from waste eucalyptus wood.
Sector: Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Using walnut waste to control plant parasites
Description: A team of researchers from the research centre CIEPQPF and the CFE of the University of Coimbra has developed an innovative application for recovered waste from walnut fruit: compounds with a “nematocidal” effect have been extracted that can control plant-parasitic nematodes affecting a wide range of species.
Sector: Research, Reuse

Title: Fibrenamics and LREC-Azores: Circular economy project for the civil construction sector in the Azores
Description: Ambiente_Sregional is a circular economy project for the civil construction sector in the Azores, developed jointly by Fibrenamics, the international platform of the University of Minho, and the Regional Laboratory of Civil Engineering (LREC-Azores).
Sector: Awareness raising, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Governance, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: SEAclic: Resource-saving packaging for temperature-sensitive foods from Storopack
Description: SEAclic is a project developed by the German company Storopack, which has created a packaging technology suitable for temperature-sensitive food products, such as fish. The bio-based version of the Storopack SEAclic Box is made from a new, compostable plastic.
Sector: Packaging, Reuse

Title: O.T.A.: making unisex shoes from recycled tyres
Description: On the Asphalt (O.T.A) is a French brand that has developed sustainable and eco-friendly unisex sneakers made of recycled tyres and leather scraps from a glove factory.
Sector: Circular design, Clothing and Fashion industry, Personal and household goods, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: The start-up Yoyo offers a behavioural-change programme for recycling
Description: Yoyo is a French start-up that has developed an innovative behavioural change approach to enhance recycling in communities.
Organisation: The start-up Yoyo offers a behavioural-change programme for recycling
Sector: Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Recycling

Title: Boat cruises on the Seine river go electric with Paris Yacht Company
Description: French company Seine Alliance repurposes EV batteries from cars to power boats for cruises on the river.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Fraunhofer IAP and re:newcell join forces to convert old cotton clothing into a mass manufacturing fibre
Description: The company re:newcell, together with a group of scientist from the Fraunhofer Institute for Applied Polymer Research (IAP), have developed a technique that transforms recycled cotton into viscose rayon fibre, which is a suitable material for mass manufacturing.
Organisation: Fraunhofer Institute for Applied Polymer Research (IAP)
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Salomon: creating a fully circular running shoe
Description: Salomon is a French company that has developed a running shoe that is 365º sustainable. This shoe has been designed to be 100% recycled easily.
Sector: Circular design, Clothing and Fashion industry

Title: Econooc beehive made from mushroom and plastic waste
Description: Econooc is a no-effort conservation beehive made from mycelium and other repurposed/sustainable materials.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Innovation and investment

Title: The City of Helsinki: supporting the reuse of excavated soil in construction projects
Description: The City of Helsinki has coordinated a project on the reuse of excavated soil in construction projects across the city. This project consists of improving coordination of how and where excavated soil is used.
Sector: Reuse, Soils, soil improvement and restoration

Title: Soeco: upcycling office furniture
Description: Soeco Kontorsmöbler is a Swedish company that recycles and refurbishes office furniture. Its goal is to take furniture which would most likely be thrown away and transform it into an item that either looks like or is new.
Sector: B2B services, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Furniture

Title: SEA2SEE makes eyewear from 100% recycled marine plastic and fishing nets
Description: SEA2SEE, based in Catalonia, designs and produces optical frames and sunglasses in Italy, as well as watches in Switzerland, entirely made from recycled marine plastic collected by fishermen in Spain, France and West Africa.
Sector: Personal and household goods, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling

Title: NCP manufactures Snøhetta design chairs made from plastic waste from Norway’s fish farming
Description: The Norwegian company NCP delivers sustainable furniture from recycled plastic materials through innovation and design. The S-1500 chair, designed by Snøhetta, is produced by NCP showing how plastic waste from Norway’s fish farming can be transformed into a sustainable design object with an expected lifetime of at least 50 years.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: ReSeaclons: collecting and recycling ocean plastic
Description: The ReSeaclons project, led by the Marine Institute of the Seaquarium in Grau-du-Roi, France, is committed to bringing together fishermen, seafarers, public authorities, associations, companies, civil society and holiday-makers to help reduce marine pollution.
Sector: Awareness raising, Circular action for climate neutrality, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Tedre Farm in Estonia explores new extraction process for a precious waste output: raspberry seed oil
Description: Tedre Farm, located in Southern Estonia, grows raspberries and produces raspberry juice and other derivatives.In 2017, in a collaboration with the Estonian University of Life Sciences, it started a project to study technologies for the extraction of oil from raspberry seeds, particularly known for its medicinal properties.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Recycling

Title: SUEZ Ecopôle's eco-hub for waste collection
Description: In France, SUEZ has invested EUR 10 million on the construction of a hub to recover waste from local businesses and authorities. Once sorted and recycled, the waste is then sold for reuse.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: KarTent: recyclable cardboard tents for European festivals
Description: The Dutch company KarTent has come up with a sustainable solution for the many tents left behind by music festival goers: a cardboard tent, designed to be purchased and transported in bulk to festival sites. After the festival, the company arranges for the tents to be removed and recycled.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse

Title: Mamukko: making bags from old sails and life rafts
Description: Mamukko is an Irish company, founded in 2011, that uses waste nautical materials as a secondary raw material. They promote upcycling by using end-of-life sails, decommissioned life rafts and recycled leather to make bags.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Product Circularity Data Sheet: a solution to access circularity data
Description: The Circularity Dataset is an initiative by Luxembourg’s Ministry of the Economy and some international industry leaders. It has now developed the “Product Circularity Data Sheet” (PCDS): a data template for standardising data about the circular aspects of products.
Organisation: PCDS Product Circularity Data Sheet Luxembourg
Sector: Digital solutions, Measuring circularity

Title: End-of-life seat belts get a new chance in Benefício's backpacks
Description: Portuguese startup Benefício devels limited edition products, with particular attention to the use of materials local knowledge. By adopting artisanal production methods and respecting fair trade and the environment, the company mostly applies the principles of circular economy, in particular upcycling.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Business incubators, Startups, Circular design, Personal and household goods, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Retail, Reuse, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Stop Food Waste: learn how to buy, store and cook better in Ireland
Description: Stop Food Waste is an Irish initiative which aims to prevent food waste through better buying, storage and cooking, as well as through home composting.
Sector: Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Food, water and nutrients, Governance, Public services, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Social impact

Title: Sopköket's garbage kitchen is the new circular trend
Description: Sopköket is a Swedish restaurant and catering company founded in 20215. It prepares meals which partly incorporate rescued and surplus food from supermarkets and other companies. Their goal is to reduce food waste.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Reuse

Title: ZĪLE: when upcycling is fashion
Description: ZĪLE is a Latvian fashion brand which develops its clothing while looking at a sustainable future, through the concept of upcycling. The label’s main resource materials are denim trousers, men’s shirts and imagination.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Clothing and Fashion industry, Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: ZIKOM: refurbishing IT equipment
Description: ZIKOM is one of the largest distributors of professionally reconditioned computer equipment in Poland.
Sector: Electronics and ICT, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Description: Music business can be circular, too! WMfono makes vinyl records from the waste that remains after cutting other records. Kayax label then packs the discs in recycled paper and employs a protection film made from maize.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Packaging, Personal and household goods, Recover, Regenerative economy, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Description: The Baltic TRAM (Transnational Research Access in the Macroregion) project strengthened the relationship between analytical research institutions and businesses by fostering cooperation between companies and researchers, linking expertise to industrial needs.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Governance, Industrial symbiosis, Innovation and investment, Research

Title: RUCONBAR project reduces road noise
Description: RUCONBAR, developed in a project which ran from 2011 to 2014, is a highly absorptive, environmentally-friendly concrete noise barrier. It is an innovative mixture of recycled waste tyres and concrete which forms a porous, lightweight, sound absorbing panel.

Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Recycling

Title: Zona Urbana's unique design products with recycled materials
Description: Zona Urbana is a fashion company based in Sofia, Bulgaria. Since 2004, it designs and manufactures products with recycled materials, mainly bags or wallets.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Recycling, Reuse, Social impact

Title: Venturis HoReCa: repurposing waste resources for the hospitality industry
Description: In Venturis HoReCa a group of professionals has joined forces, knowledge, expertise and ideas to tackle the problem of food waste. They have developed IT systems (KuMin.Sys and KuMin.App) to monitor and reduce food waste in kitchens and canteens. Monitoring of food waste is the first important step in the process of reduction. Venturis HoReCa also advises companies on how to limit food waste.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: RECOSI - refurbishing ICT products for re-use
Description: RECOSI is a social franchise focusing on the reuse and refurbishment of ICT and WEEE.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Electronics and ICT, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: REC.ON creates high quality furniture from automobile parts
Description: REC.ON creates its production by recovering auto parts. Using a unique upcycling process, they transform used, unwanted parts of automobiles into new, high-quality, functional pieces of design, adding style and an industrial aesthetic to any interior. Moreover, they have a unique process of acquiring their materials.
Sector: Furniture, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Re-Match is recycling synthetic turf
Description: Re-Match has a recycling process for synthetic turf, recovering up to 95% of the materials, which is accredited with the EU’s Environmental Technology Verification. Their patented technology separates the sand, backing, rubber and plastic fibre from used synthetic turf. These materials can then be sold or used in a wide variety of new products in different industries.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Re-food: volunteer driven community charity working to eliminate food waste and hunger on a neighborhood basis
Description: Re-food is an independent, citizen driven, fully volunteer, eco-humanitarian community charity, working to eliminate food waste and hunger on a neighbourhood basis. This Portuguese movement targets at ending food waste and hunger by saving food which was going to waste at local venues.
Sector: Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Food, water and nutrients, Personal and household services, Product as a Service, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Social impact

Title: Last Minute Market - recovering and reusing unsold goods
Description: Last Minute Market is a social enterprise, founded in 1998 as a research initiative and now a spin-off from the University of Bologna. Today, it is an entrepreneurial society working at the national level in Italy, developing local projects to recover unsold goods and benefit non-profit organisations. Its objective is zero waste.
Sector: Recover, Regenerative economy, Reuse, Social impact

Title: ELWIS: an Electronic Waste Registration System for a more responsible approach towards waste by households
Description: In Slovakia and Czechia, an initiative set by three recent graduates has been positively impacting the sector of waste management in both countries. The Elwis Waste Registration System has the objective to increase efficiency in the cities’ waste management systems by helping reducing the amount of mixed waste.
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Digital solutions, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Sustainable and biodegradable LENZING™ ECOVERO™ viscose fiber comes from the woods
Description: LENZING™ ECOVERO™ produces a sustainable and fully biodegradable fibre brand for apparel. It is developed from renewable pulp and wood sources. Importantly, the wood which serves as raw material come from certified sustainable sources.
Sector: Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI), Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: 013Circles promotes circular textiles
Description: 013Circles is an initiative by the Dutch municipality of Tilburg for the promotion of circular textiles.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Reuse, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Kitchen Dates – a restaurant without a rubbish bin
Description: Kitchen Dates is an environmentally friendly restaurant located in Lisbon. It has the particularity of operating without generating any waste - so no use for rubbish bins!

Description: GoodAfter.com is an online supermarket focused on products near their recommended consumption date or, in certain cases, even after their "best-before" date.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Retail

Title: Fil&Fab transforms disused fishing nets into pellets to create new plastic products
Description: Fil&Fab has developed a technique to transform disused end-of-life fishing nets into plastic sheets, which are then used to create a series of new plastic products.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse

Title: Fairmittlerei, supplying NGOs with industry's excess equipment and materials
Description: Fairmittlerei works as a connection hub between NGOs and industries for the purchasing of excess non-food products in industries.
Key Area: Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Corporate Procurement, Furniture, Reuse

Title: Fibracat: an absorbing use for waste paper
Description: Fibracat has developed cellulose-based absorbents from paper for use in the cleaning and industrial hygiene sectors.
Sector: Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI), Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Espigoladors - food waste prevention and job creation for groups at risk of social exclusion
Description: Espigoladorsis a social enterprise focused on preventing food waste and empowering people prone to social exclusion.
Key Area: Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: Carlavelorep: the social bicycle workshop
Description: Carlavelorepis a non-profit social bicycle workshop run by Caritas Salzburg.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse

Title: Bio2Materials creates 'leather' from apples
Description: Bio2Materials is a company which makes a 100% biodegradable 'leather' from apples – the main type of fruit grown in Poland.
Sector: Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Amorim Cork group: recycling, reusing and reinventing the use of cork
Description: The Amorim Group is among the cork industry’s world leaders. It has a business unit focused on recycling, reusing, and reinventing the use of cork - alone or mixed with other raw materials - in the generation of new products and applications (construction, footwear, aerospace, railways, etc.).
Sector: Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: SHAREBOX - secure management platform for shared process resources
Description: The Horizon-2020 SHAREBOX project promoted industrial symbiosis by developing an online platform providing information on waste resources (i.e. energy, water, residues, etc.) that could be used to replace primary resources, to plant managers and other decision-makers.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Digital solutions, Industrial symbiosis

Title: Alchemia-nova: treating waste water using green walls
Description: Alchemia-nova, the Institute for innovative phytochemistry and closed loop processes, has colloborated with vertECO, GRETA and LooPi to develop three types of green walls, which treat wastewater to service water standards and create plant biomass and fertiliser.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Research, Soils, soil improvement and restoration

Title: Pack, Wrap and Store with Beeswax Wraps by Malu
Description: Beewraps by Malu is a food packaging material designed and produced by a Polish family company  to replace food foil, aluminum foil or disposable plastic containers with a biodegradable and reusable alternative.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Packaging

Title: reWINE: reusing wine bottles
Description: reWINE LIFE is a Catalonian project, running from 2016 to 2020 and co-financed by the EU's LIFE Programme. It sought to demonstrate the viability of reusing glass bottles in the local wine industry.
Sector: Recycling, Reuse

Title: Orybany: the first zero-waste eco-responsible gift shop in Brussels
Description: Orybany is an ethical concept store located in the heart of Brussels working with a community of artisans and designers connected by the same values: "Human, Ethical and Diversity".
Sector: Circular design, Clothing and Fashion industry, Education and skills, Social impact

Title: Veolia: recycling PET bottles into new food packaging
Description: Veolia has been extending the useful life of plastic bottles using a PET (Poly Ethylene Terephthalate) plastic recycling process. A mechanical and chemical recovery process transforms the PET flakes into a product suitable for use with food.
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Vanheede Environment Group: collecting packaged food waste to produce alternative fuels
Description: Vanheede Biomass Solutions processes packaged or unpackaged food items that, for various reasons, are no longer fit for human or animal consumption. Fermentable residue is gathered and processed at a bio-methanisation plant in order to generate green energy.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Packaging, Recycling, Soils, soil improvement and restoration, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Triade Electronique: recycling WEEE
Description: Veolia has developed expertise and built specific facilities to tackle the complex process of treating, depolluting and dismantling Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE). This is a valuable source of recyclable raw materials: ferrous metals, plastics and precious metals can all be recovered and reused.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Electronics and ICT, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: The SAWYER project: identifying skills and safety needs for the furniture sector's circular transition
Description: The SAWYER project aims to facilitate the transition of European furniture companies to a more circular economy. The project ran from February 2020 to March 2021, studying the main legislative and voluntary instruments that can facilitate this transition.
Sector: Furniture

Title: I:CO - a global waste collection network for textiles
Description: I:CO is an international circular solutions provider for the collection, certified sorting, reuse and recycling of clothing and shoes. They aim to support innovative new recycling technologies which help close the loop of production cycles.
Sector: B2B services, Clothing and Fashion industry, Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Souji: transforming used cooking oil into an ecological detergent
Description: SOUJI is a liquid based on minerals and vegetables that, when mixed in the correct proportions with used cooking oil, and after shaking the mixture for 1 minute, becomes a cleaning agent/detergent which is 96% less polluting than a common detergent.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Industrial techniques, Personal and household goods

Title: SIGUREC: Smart machines for recyclable waste
Description: SIGUREC was the most advanced household waste collection service operating in Romania until March 2020. It was a broad initiative, implemented following an official agreement between private companies and public authorities.
Sector: Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: ResQ - finding a buyer for that leftover cupcake
Description: ResQ Club is a Finnish company and mobile application, which also covers parts of Sweden, Poland and Germany. Its goal is to combat food waste by connecting sustainable restaurants, cafés and food shops with consumers who appreciate affordable quality food.
Sector: Electronics and ICT, Food, water and nutrients

Title: Millor que nou - Repaired to be better than new
Description: The “Millor que nou” (Better than new) campaign is an initiative from the Barcelona Metropolitan Area (AMB) that started in 2009. It provides people with free support services and access to repair shops, so that they can learn how to repair appliances and objects.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Remondis Aqua: extracting phosphoric acids from sewerage sludge
Description: Remondis Acqua Group is a company specialising in systems for the production of high-quality water. They have developed new methods to protect raw materials and treat wastewater, with a new model of municipal sewerage treatment plant.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Po-Dzielnia: the Polish Sharing Economy Centre
Description: Po-Dzielnia is a freeshop and sharing economy centre in Poland. It is run by a team of nearly two dozen volunteers and five activists.
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Neocomp: recycling glass-fibre-reinforced plastics
Description: Neocomp has developed a method for recycling glass fibre polymers used in the rotor blades of wind turbines. The polymers are shredded, then used as an additive in cement.

Title: Lassila&Tikanoja: collecting and processing waste oils
Description: L&T organises the collection of waste oils, oil-contaminated water and a range of emulsions from industry. The collected materials are analysed and processed at L&T’s recycling plant.

Title: Green Dot Cyprus - a collective compliance system for packaging and packaging waste
Description: Green Dot Cyprus is the first collective compliance system for packaging and packaging waste in Cyprus.
Sector: Packaging, Recycling

Title: Fruta Feia or Ugly Fruit finds beauty in misshaped fruit
Description: The cooperativeFruta Feia(“ugly fruit”, in Portuguese) has been preventing the waste of so-called “ugly” fruit in Portugal, that are not usually sold in markets.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients

Title: Better World Fashion is circular fashion: 98% reuse - 100% unique
Description: Better World Fashion produces new quality products from waste materials. Their primary material, leather, is from discarded post-consumer products collected by NGOs.

Title: Replacing single-use water containers with glass in the Basque Country
Description: Mutualia, a social services and medical care provider in the Basque Country, Spain, has installed water fountains connected to the public water network to use tap water instead of buying bottled water.
