Sector: Packaging, Public procurement, Water

Title: Green public procurement: successful example of increasing brick recovery in demolition services
Description: In 2018, Hjørring Municipality decided to embark on a pilot project to increase the recovery and recycling of bricks when procuring demolition services for two buildings at the end of their functional life. Once cleared, the sites were destinated to be a part of a new climate adaptation project including a new rainwater collection basin and a recreational area.
Type of Organisation: Network of local and/or regional authorities
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Public procurement

Title: Reducing packaging through procurement criteria
Description: See how circular procurement can help reduce waste in the CatalanLa Mercè Race.
Sector: Packaging, Public procurement, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: All public services in  Ludwigsburg enjoy  “Cradle to Cradle” office material thanks to green public procurement
Description: The city of Ludwigsburg in Germany has a sustainable development strategy that  includes the use of procurement to achieve its sustainability  goals, instructing all public procurement departments to follow “Cradle  to  Cradle”principles in their procurement and awarding criteria.
Type of Organisation: Network of local and/or regional authorities
Sector: Public procurement

Title: Refurbishing a kindergarten building with minimal environmental impact in Koprivnica
Description: In 2018, the Croatian city of Koprivnica needed to replace a prefabricated kindergarten. Instead of demolishing the building entirely, Koprivnica opted for Green Public Procurement (GPP) and aimed to maintain as much of the physical structure as possible, while refurbishing and improving it.
Type of Organisation: Network of local and/or regional authorities
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Public procurement

Title: FOREWEAR - inclusive social enterprise reusing and recycling clothing
Description: FOREWEAR is a project based in the Czech Republic. It collects unwanted clothing from company employees and donates them to charity organisations. Part of the material is recycled and, together with surpluses from textile industrial productions, is then used to produce recycled products printed with companies' branding.
Sector: Awareness raising, Reuse, Social impact, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: EcoProtech Oy: turning waste organic material into biogas
Description: EcoProtech has developed the EPAD (EcoProtech Advanced Digestion) technology. EPAD is based on a continuous, industrial scale, anaerobic digestion process.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Energy and waste-to-energy, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: eChiller - highly energy-efficient cooler with minimal global warming impact
Description: eChiller is a refrigerator system developed and manufactured by the German company Efficient Energy which uses only water.
Sector: Energy and waste-to-energy, Innovation and investment, Water

Title: Machiels Group: closing materials loops through enhanced landfill mining
Description: Enhanced Landfill Mining (ELFM) of historic (and future) landfills is a key part of the solution for closing material loops. It addresses major societal challenges by recovering materials, energy and land. Machiels' ‘Closing the Circle’ project will be the first to put ELFM into practice.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Innovation and investment, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Preparing for a circular playground: a tender for creative spaces to play and learn in Aalborg
Description: As part of the Circular Public Procurement project, the City of Aalborg (Denmark) has established a new innovative approach to buying playgrounds, based on the principles of a circular economy, as well as grounded in a pedagogical understanding of creative play as an important part of a child’s development.
Type of Organisation: Network of local and/or regional authorities
Sector: Culture, Sports and Leisure activities, Housing and Urban development, Public procurement

Title: WOODYLOOP: circular pyjamas
Description: The Woody Group, a company which manufactures pyjamas, wants to use raw materials more efficiently and responsibly in the future. It also wants to take more responsibility for its products once they are put on the market.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: The Flemish government’s Facility Services Agency opts for circular office furnishings
Description: The Facility Services Agency drew up an inventory of all the surplus office furniture from the various departments of the Flemish government. This made it much easier to give the chairs, desks and cupboards etc. a second life.
Sector: Circular design, Furniture, Governance, Reuse

Title: Marypup's upcycled rainwear
Description: Marypup recovers thousands of tents which have been thrown away and uses the fabric to make rainwear. This is upcycling: the waste is recovered, transformed and given a new life.
Sector: Reuse, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Convert makes every fibre matter
Description: Convert works to support UN Sustainable Development Goal 12: ensuring sustainable consumption and production patterns. It explores how natural sustainable resources can be used to make new products and seeks to reduce the amount of waste on earth through recycling and upcycling. Every fibre matters when waste fibres are used as non-woven material.
Sector: Circular design, Furniture, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: CEnTOUR or how to help SMEs in the tourism sector transition towards circular economy
Description: This COSME project aims to implement a capacity building and support scheme for SMEs in the tourism sector that will lead them to reach different levels of Circular Economy innovations within a transition system.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Industrial symbiosis, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: LanaTerm: wool can keep buildings warm as well as sheep
Description: There are not many eco-friendly products on the Romanian construction market, so there was definitely a niche in the thermal insulation market. LanaTerm uses sheep's wool to create thermal insulation for buildings.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure

Title: Community reuse center Baterkáreň brings life to the circular economy principles
Description: Baterkáreň's mission is to make sustainability (circular economy principles and associated environmental protection) accessible to the general public, in order to render communities capable to adapt as effectively as possible to the potential impacts of climate change in the area.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Empowering Consumers

Title: The Fabric Sales - an almost complete circular fashion powerhouse
Description: At theFabric Sales, a new model has been developed for repurposing and extending the life of designer fabrics.
Key Area: Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Circular design, Recycling, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Reuse, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: CiLAB collective creates new circular concepts on textile and furniture waste
Description: Together with the students for furniture design of VOMO the CiLAB collective started a journey creating new circular concepts based on textile and furniture waste. The concepts do not only facilitate awareness but also link with the local community and the city of Mechelen.
Sector: Awareness raising, Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Sheltersuit: upcycling materials to provide shelter for people living on the streets
Description: The Sheltersuit Foundation has three goals: helping people in need, closing the gap in the labour market and reducing waste. It produces wind- and waterproof coats that can be transformed into a sleeping bag, and are distributed free of charge to homeless people and people in refugee camps.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Recycling

Title: REFUCOAT: recycling food packaging and preventing salmonella
Description: The European REFUCOAT project developed innovative, efficient, bioplastic food packaging production processes using renewable, recyclable materials which could replace conventional fossil fuel-based raw materials. Three different bio-based active packaging systems were developed.
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Circular design, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Titan Greece: making circular cement a reality
Description: Titan Greece - a cement and building material producer - plays an active role in the implementation of a circular economy model at various stages of the production process.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Industrial symbiosis, Recycling

Title: Ostraco: from discarded oyster shells to beautiful glass
Description: In France, the designer Lucile Viaud found her way to contribute to organic recycling. More precisely, to recycling of seafood waste. Her work is focused on transforming oyster shells into glass.
Sector: Ceramics and Glass, Circular design, Personal and household goods, Recycling

Title: SirPlus: the supermarket that rescues unwanted food - rescuing as a new way of buying
Description: SirPlus, based in Germany, is an example of a business which avoids food waste to its utmost. It consists of a supermarket that sells food rejected by other stores for being considered out of the regular aesthetics for a supermarket – for instance, ugly fruit and vegetables, jars labelled incorrectly, or goods near or past expiry date.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Reuse

Title: Circular architecture: RAU makes brand new buildings from recycled building materials
Description: RAU has been working in the architectural sector focusing on the design of sustainable buildings. Their projects include buildings for public/private sectors, with an integrated design methodology.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure

Title: CIAK handles 70 000 tons of waste yearly, sustaining a circular battery market in Croatia
Description: CIAK is a waste management company from Croatia that focuses on recovering hazardous and non-hazardous waste. Focusing on recovering and recycling accumulators and batteries, CIAK helps closing the loop for these products.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles

Title: RecycLivre – the online second-hand book shop
Description: RecycLivre.com is a website selling second-hand books which aims to establish a relationship based on solidarity between its customers and underprivileged groups. It is built around the idea of promoting the recirculation of books instead of them being thrown away by their owners.
Sector: Culture, Sports and Leisure activities, Reuse

Title: Rewarding recycling with vouchers
Description: Tropa Verde was set up in Santiago de Compostela, Spain in 2015, and seeks to encourage environmentally responsible behaviour. Its goal is to promote recycling by rewarding environmentally-friendly practices.
Sector: Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Fashion can be sustainable
Description: Filippa K is a Swedish fashion brand which has taken significant steps to support sustainable consumption and design. The brand follows the "four Rs" of Reduce, Reuse, Recycle, Repair in order to encourage more mindful consumption and diminish fashion's impact on the environment.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry

Title: Upcycled clothing for downcycled prices
Description: Reet Aus is a PhD-qualified fashion designer who founded her own brand that focuses on sustainable fashion. She has studied the issue of waste in the fashion industry.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry

Title: Recycling on a massive scale
Description: Remondis is one of the world's largest recycling, service and water companies with over 30 000 employees and 900 business locations. The Lippe plant in Lünen is one of their largest sustainable projects: it has a surface area of 230 ha and is the largest industrial recycling plant in Europe.
Sector: Industrial techniques, Recycling, Refineries

Title: An unexpected ally in promoting sustainability: flies!
Description: Nasekomo is a company based in Bulgaria that uses insects (specifically Black Soldier Flies) to produce sustainable insect protein, oils and fertilisers that can be used for feed and in agricultural industries. Nasekomo’s goal is to use – and increase the usage of – these insects as part of a global solution to the issues caused by the exponential consumption of meat.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Circular design, Food, water and nutrients

Title: Beer in paper bottles: what's not to like?
Description: The Carlsberg Group, in cooperation with innovation experts EcoXpac, packaging company BillerudKorsnäs and post-doctoral researchers from the Technical University of Denmark, have been working on "Green Fibre Bottles" – a "paper bottle" for beer.
Sector: Packaging

Title: Recycling batteries to safeguard natural resources
Description: Rombat is the largest producer of car batteries in Romania. Since 2005, the company has been collecting vehicle batteries to extract the lead they contain, recycle them and manufacture new batteries. The batteries are processed at the 3.7 ha Rebat facility in Copșa Mică.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles

Title: Recycling PU foam cans more efficiently
Description: PDR is a German company with extensive expertise in recycling materials, which has developed a groundbreaking technique to reuse polyurethane (PU) foam cans. In Germany, about 25 million cans are used each year, and a federal legislature has classified used PU foam cans as polluting waste which must be recycled.
Sector: B2B services, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Fortunale: thanks to 100% organic wool and natural dyes, these Italian sweaters combine high recyclability with style
Description: Fortunale is entirely eco-friendly, and it is inspired by modern principles of circular economy: a Fortunale sweater is designed, from its origin, to be recycled at the end of its natural use until 80%, because it is made of pure wool, and this precious characteristic allows us to regenerate its fibers into new prime materials.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Innovation and investment

Title: Recovering and cleaning shavings and metal waste by applying centrifugal force of nature
Description: Nuova Sara oil separator centrifuges apply centrifugal force to separate shavings and metal waste. The de-oiled shavings can be recovered and valorised as secondary raw materials.
Sector: Machinery and Equipment, Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling

Title: A refreshing first: citrus peel as a raw material
Description: PeelPioneers is the first company in the world to use citrus peel to create new raw materials. The peels are left over from making fresh juice, collected from supermarkets and the catering industry.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients

Title: An e-commerce portal for restored goods to increase the visibility of circular handicrafts in Turin
Description: The City of Turin is financing some circular-economy oriented projects, among them theBalonMarketplace, an e-commerce portal for stakeholders who are active in the antiques, second-hand, vintage and reuse sectors, for a sustainable consumption of goods with a high cultural and heritage value. The portal aims to share ancient and past know-how and skills by promoting handycrafts shops.
Sector: Furniture, Recover, Regenerative economy, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Quid Project - sustainable and ethical fashion
Description: Quid provides jobs for vulnerable people, especially women, in a field for which Italy is renowned: fashion. Quid markets its ethical and sustainable clothing under the label Quid Project. The project sources the raw material from the Italian fashion and textile world, using production surpluses and end-of-series fabrics. It therefore combines social and environmental impact.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Recover, Regenerative economy, Reuse, Social Enterprise

Title: Remix El Barrio - Co-designing with Biomaterials from food leftovers
Description: Remix El Barrio engages with stakeholders and innovative designers to support a circular transition which revalues surplus food and biowaste.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Circular design, Recover, Regenerative economy, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: 'Terra di Tutti' turns waste material into opportunities for refugees or disadvantaged people
Description: TERRA DI TUTTI(meaning "Everybody's earth") is a social enterprise in the Tuscan Region giving a second life to scraps and promoting handicrafts as an opportunity for different cultures to meet.
Sector: N/A

Title: A social cooperative fighting against the throwaway culture and exclusion
Description: TheTreottounoSocial Cooperative of Forlì (Italy) is committed to the implementation of circular economy systems where everything can be recycled, both goods/waste and people.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling, Reuse, Social impact

Title: NoW™ Technology ensures that your packaging and paper-based products are used again and again
Description: Thanks to a No Waste Technology, flexible packaging becomes recyclable in the paper supply chain.
Sector: Innovation and investment, Packaging

Title: Upcycling and creative recovery by a sustainable enterprise of handicraftswomen
Description: ISA - a sustainable enterprise of handicraftswomen - gives special attention to sustainability in its production chain, by employing production scraps and waste from diverse local companies, preferably choosing natural and ecofriendly products.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Circular design, Furniture, Recover, Regenerative economy, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse

Title: LEVEL-UP Circularity Protocols provide large industrial equipment with a longer life
Description: The EU-financed LEVEL-UP project offers circularity protocols and strategies for extending the remaining useful life of large industrial equipment and assets that can no longer remain competitive in the Industry 4.0 paradigm.
Sector: Digital solutions, Electronics and ICT, Innovation and investment, Machinery and Equipment, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse

Title: Wallenius Water Innovation’s contribution to a circular economy: Using UV light to resist bacterial growth in metalworking fluids
Description: Wallenius Water Innovation is a Swedish clean-tech company that works with UV light to prevent bacterial growth in metalworking fluids. The non-toxic solution secures long-lasting process fluids without using hazardous biocides. In this way, fluids can more easily be reused in the installation rather than be disposed.
Sector: Chemical management, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Water

Title: Recovery of HDPE products by Jcoplastic for recycling and transformation in secondary raw materials
Description: Post consumer High Density Polyethylene (HDPE) products are bought back, disassembled after cleaning and sanitation process, and then shredded by Jcoplastic. The secondary raw material obtained is analysed and characterised, then extruded for reusing in a new production cycle.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recover, Regenerative economy, Recycling, Reuse

Title: Life Is.ECO or how to recycle bitumen-polymer membranes and glass-fiber-based insulating material
Description: The Life Is.ECO project was aimed to create and implement an integrated system for the treatment of production waste and obsolescences of bitumen-polymer membranes and insulating mineral based on glass fiber, for their recycling and reintroduction in their respective production processes.
Sector: Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Urban Wood - making the most of urban trees
Description: Legno Urbano is an innovative project developed in Italy to promote wood recovery from trees which are felled in urban areas because of their age, their instability or spatial planning needs.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Housing and Urban development

Title: Rigiocattolo reduces, reuses, recycles and rethinks toys
Description: Rigiocattolo collects used toys, regenerates and puts them back into circulation. Its ambition is to become a bigger and renowed re-use centre that can also offer people a decent job.
Key Area: Consumption, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse

Title: Life-REPOLYUSE
Description: The Life-REPOLYUSE project is about REcovery of POLYurethane for reUSE in eco-efficient materials. It tries to solve the environmental challenge of the scarcity of resources and waste management in order to mitigate the effects of climate change. It addresses the problem of polyurethane plastic waste using innovative techniques.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: From a broken umbrella to a flying kite: a social cooperative that reinterprets discarded objects
Description: The Lister Sartoria Sociale cooperative interprets the textile product in relation to the urban habitat, retracing its socio-economic transformations, memories, reworking its codes, styles and materials. Discarded objects, fabrics and garments are collected and reworked, crossing experimentation and traditional techniques.
Sector: Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Life DOP & Virgilio: Circular economy in a high-quality dairy industry
Description: This Life DOP project operated in partnership with the Italian dairy company Consorzio Latterie Virgilio uses livestock waste in anaerobic digestion plants to produce renewable energy and renewable fertilisers (solid digestate) which are then exported to non-livestock areas.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Food, water and nutrients, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Recycling of obsolete furniture and furnishings by Revì
Description: Revì aims to have a social impact by raising awareness about recycling furniture and encouraging local crafts. It also has an environmental impact by recovering material which would otherwise be classed as rubbish.

Title: RIUSO³ – Banco del riuso in Franciacorta
Description: Riuso³ – Banco del riuso in Franciacorta is a physical space above municipal level dedicated to a series of active policies geared towards conscious consumption and waste reduction through the exchange and recovery of goods.
Organisation: RIUSO³ – Banco del riuso in Franciacorta
Sector: Reuse

Title: MontECOlino's carpet recovery from trade fairs
Description: MontECOlino has always had a keen interest in the environmental impact of its products. It has developed a carpet management system for the exhibition industry that recovers the carpet after use and transforms it into a new raw material for use in other sectors, in line with the circular economy concept.
Sector: Industrial techniques, Reuse, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: HISER project (H2020): Holistic innovative solutions for efficient recycling and recovery of valuable raw materials
Description: HISER's main objective is to develop and demonstrate holistic, technological and cost-effective solutions to increase recovery rates from increasingly complex construction and demolition waste (C&DW), with due regard for circular economy principles on the value chain in the construction sector (from buildings' end of life to new buildings).
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Industrial techniques, Recycling, Reuse

Title: Cultivation using wool
Description: In order to create a new commercial use for raw wool, the Italian associationPost Industriale Ruralitàhas developed a form of vertical hydroponic cultivation using wool instead of soil.

Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Inspired by its urban surroundings, Barcelona Rugs upcycles scraps to create mosaics of rugs
Description: In their collection named Trencadís,Barcelona Rugs uses spare scraps from various materials of high quality to create unique rugs.

Sector: Furniture, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: The leading "packaging-as-a-service" from reCIRCLE for takeaway food and drinks
Description: reCIRCLE is the market-leading industrial solution for reusable packaging for takeaway catering. The "lunchbox as a service" concept saves millions of disposable containers every day.

Sector: Awareness raising, Circular action for climate neutrality, Food, water and nutrients, Packaging, Product as a Service, Reuse

Title: Photovoltaic cells: clean energy from wine waste
Description: Giving value to waste as a precious renewable resource: for the first time, agri-food waste can be exploited to create photovoltaic cells that produce sustainable electricity. From the residues derived from winemaking (normally disposed of without any other use), researchers can extract natural dyes that capture solar energy, transforming them into a regenerated green resource.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Energy and waste-to-energy, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: The key to plastic recycling is found in the handling of food grade PET
Description: PET is currently the only plastic that can be 100 % recycled. Food grade PET is the key to plastic waste recycling. No other plastics are permitted for reuse in the production of new food packaging.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce, Reuse, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Recycling polyurethane foam in pressurised containers
Description: PU foam pressurised containers are used to fill gaps and to insulate and install window and door frames so as to make buildings airtight. OCF (one-component foam) producers have invested in a recycling company which recycles the metals in the packaging material, the reactive residual polyurethane prepolymer and the propellant.

Title: Reconstituting limestone C&D waste into premium/high-quality masonry products
Description: The University of Malta has developed a patented process that recycles limestone and concrete construction and demolition waste into masonry products. These have superior mechanical properties compared to natural limestone products.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Industrial techniques, Innovation and investment, Recycling

Title: Recovering nutrients from waste
Description: Ragn-Sells collects, treats and recycles waste and residual products from businesses, organisations and households.
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Chemical management, Energy and waste-to-energy, Industrial techniques, Mining, metals and minerals

Title: Close the Glass Loop: a multi-stakeholder partnership to collect more, better quality glass
Description: Close the Glass Loopwants to achieve an average of 90% collection rate of used glass packaging at EU level by 2030 and a better quality of recycled glass.
Sector: Ceramics and Glass, Packaging, Recycling

Title: Circular Navarre Catalogue
Description: The Circular Navarre Catalogue is a booklet showcasing 20 organisations - based on circular business models - in the Navarre region, who are looking for international cooperation.

Description: The project idea called Urban Click is focused on finding a solution to promote recycling and reuse of construction and demolition waste (CDW) within the construction sector in urban areas of Europe.
Key Area: Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: B2B services, Business incubators, Startups

Title: EKORU: Recycling Finnish antique coins and old spoons to make jewelry
Description: Finnish jewelry company EKORU makes jewelry out of discarded Finnish coins, old silver spoons and other cutlery. After Finland changed to the Euro, the metal of old Finnish coins found other purposes.
Sector: Circular design, Clothing and Fashion industry, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse

Title: Concular - Digital platform enabling circular construction
Description: Concular disrupts the construction industry by developing a circular process for material flow. The system is based on an AI-driven platform that matches buyers’ demand for construction material with suppliers’ circular materials.

Title: Volvo Cars EV battery materials traceability
Description: Volvo Cars commissioned Circulor to implement a technology-enabled traceability solution, to enable an end-to-end chain of custody to be constructed, initially for Cobalt and subsequently for Mica, with other materials being planned.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Circular action for climate neutrality

Title: Circular economy approach to industrial wastewater
Description: ZERO BRINE proposes a circular economy approach to reduce the negative impacts of brine from process industries and create economic value from the reuse of its constituents, such as sodium chloride, magnesium, calcium, sulphates, sodium bicarbonate, heat and fresh water.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Chemical management, Soils, soil improvement and restoration, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Fair hairdressers - recycled hair as a resource
Description: Fair hairdressers (Coiffeurs Justes) give hair left on the floor in their salons for reuse in sectors such as agriculture, construction and environmental protection.
Sector: Recycling, Reuse

Title: Finnish company Pa-Ri Materia extends the life of office furniture
Description: Finnish company Pa-Ri Materia gives used office furniture a second life by refurbishing and selling it. The company purchases some of the furniture it recycles, while certain companies pay for their furniture to be recycled or reused.
Sector: Furniture

Title: Solar Foods: new edible protein food from air and electricity
Description: The Finnish foodtech company, Solar Foods, produces natural single-cell protein using simply renewable electricity and air, called Solein®. They bring to the market an entirely new kind of food that is both natural, and not dependent on agriculture, climate or the weather. The protein can be made in tough environmental conditions, such as the desert, the Arctic, or possibly even in space.

Title: Circular South, Antwerp: community-driven sustainable area, with the help of smart technologies
