The platform has been set up in collaboration with the Flemish Construction Confederation, construction company BESIX, Circular Flanders and FLOOW2, to create a more circular construction sector.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Digital solutions, Reuse

Title: Denmark learns from Belgium on how to create repair and reuse networks
Description: In September 2018, the Danish inter-municipal waste management company AVV, which serves two Danish municipalities, visited the City of Brussels and its surroundings as part of a study visit on setting up effective repair and reuse systems. The visit was carried out within the framework of the TAIEX Peer-2-Peer EU Programme and with the support of Municipal Waste Europe and Bruxelles Environment.
Type of Organisation: Network of local and/or regional authorities
Sector: Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Social Enterprise, Social impact

Title: GIDA purification plant: PPP providing high-quality water for the textile industry while limiting water consumption
Description: GIDA is a wastewater treatment plant that helps meet the needs of the local textile industry by supplying water of sufficiently high quality, while keeping water consumption to a minimum.
Organisation: G.I.D.A. S.p.A. Gestione Impianti Depurazione Acque
Sector: Public services, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: La Caverne d'Ali Baba: a re-use library for art students at ESA Saint-Luc, Brussels
Description: TheCaverne d'Ali Baba(Ali Baba thieve's cave) is an initiative by and for students in the art school of ESA Saint-Luc, in Brussels.According to theFédération des Récupérathèques, of which the initiative belongs to, the service stands as a shared and co-managed warehouse of reuse materials, available to students for any of their creative projects.
Sector: Reuse

Title: LaverVert: recycling wood ash for an all-natural laundry detergent
Description: LaverVert is an organic detergent whose ingredients are 100% natural, with a circular cleaning agent. It is produced with wood ash recycled from industrial pellet stoves, reviving a traditional practice to use wood ash for its ability to bind with fats in creating an all-natural soap.
Sector: Industrial symbiosis, Personal and household goods, Recycling

Title: The Fair Plastic Alliance: give plastic a second life - and people a better one
Description: The Fair Plastic Alliance believes that plastic waste management based on a not-for-private-profit business model is a powerful solution to generate a positive impact on the environment and on the society as a whole, in both developed and developing countries. It is a multi-stakeholder network spreading social responsibility in plastic waste management.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Social Enterprise, Social impact

Title: Super Circular Estate: joining material and social circularity to respond to citizens' new demographics and needs
Description: The Super Circular Estate project addresses the challenge of changing housing needs. The Parkstad Limburg region’s population, is estimated to shrink by 27% in the next 30 years, calling for a radical reorientation in housing facilities. The project aims at demolishing vacant outdated high-rise apartment buildings, and reuse their components to establish new social housing units.
Sector: Governance, Housing and Urban development, Public services, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Social impact

Title: VertECO: a vertical ecosystem for indoor and outdoor greywater treatment
Description: VertECO consists of a vertical ecosystem (vertical constructed wetland) treating greywater from handwash basins, showers, and laundries.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Lopyanko's project: from bombix mori to raw silk... and much more
Description: Lopyanko's Agri_Gaya'18 project aims at developing sustainable and circular exploitation of thebombix mori(silkworm) in Northern Bulgaria. Besides the production of organic silk and other valuable byproducts, the project establishes protective forest belts of mulberry trees, an agroforestry model particularly well-suited to the Danube Region.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Food, water and nutrients, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Saint Francis of Assisi: rendering a religious community sustainable and circular
Description: Fra’ Sole is a sustainability project involving the monument complex of Saint Francis of Assisi and its nearby areas, which has resulted in the elimination of disposable products, infrastructure for rainwater reuse and a 20% reduction in overall waste.
Sector: Governance

Title: Greenrail: innovative & eco-sustainable railway sleepers
Description: Greenrail sleepers consist of an outer cover made of a blend of ELTs and recycled plastic, and an inner core of pre-stressed, reinforced concrete.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Mobility and transport, Recycling

Title: 'Own Less Live More' - just borrow from the 'fashion library'
Description: Lena is the first fashion library of the Netherlands, where you can borrow clothing with a subscription, or buy through the try-before-you-buy principle. An endless wardrobe with the benefits of a fast changing wardrobe, placed in a sustainable context.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Product as a Service

Title: ecoHORNET develops multi-system burner with ecological combustion procedure to create pyrolysis gas, oil and biochar
Description: ecoHORNET, a Romanian SME, has developed a recycling station that uses pyrolysis technology to transform industrial biomass, household waste and sewage sludge into bio-gas, bio-oil and biochar in addition to creating thermal energy for hot water and air generators.
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Energy and waste-to-energy, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Plastics recyclates: Plastship offer services for better quality and marketability
Description: plastship, successfully launched in May 2019, is a German digital startup that has created a trading and service platform for buyers and sellers of regrinds, re-granulates and recyclates.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: B2B services, Chemical management, Measuring circularity, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: La Polveriera: recycling old military warehouses into a vibrant space for civic and social initiatives
Description: The "Polveriera" is an urban regeneration project that converted an ancient military warehouse into a beautiful civic centre hosting several activities: learning and residential centre for disabled people, offices for cooperatives and NGOs, co-working space, auditorium, a shop and a restaurant-cafè.
Sector: Housing and Urban development, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Social Enterprise, Social impact

Title: Mater-Biotech - the first world industrial plant for the production of bio-butanediol from renewable sources
Description: Inaugurated in 2016, Mater-Biotech is the first world industrial plant for the production of 1.4 bio-butanediol (BDO) directly from sugars, paving the way for the production of new chemical intermediates from renewable sources. The plant was designed to reuse the by-products for its energy needs, thus optimizing the life cycle of the entire process.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Bioplastic foodservice ware, mulch film and packaging make plastic waste recycling more circular
Description: Novamont produces biopolymer products that are 100 % biodegradable and compostable from its MATER-BI® material for catering, agriculture and packaging.
Sector: B2B services, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Circular and Bioeconomy Centre: promoting industrial symbiosis in Lapland
Description: The Circular and Bioeconomy Centre is based ona cross-sectoral industry co-operation involving mining, metal, and forest industries and service companies in the Kemi-Tornio economic region, and accounts for about 80 % of Lapland's industrial production.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Industrial symbiosis, Mining, metals and minerals

Title: 'Recycle your shoes, repave your way': from worn out sneakers to renewed play and sports areas
Description: Esosport was founded in 2009, by a small group of avid sports people, wanting to find a better use for old sports shoes than simply being thrown away.Indeed, once they have exhausted their support and performance potential, recycled sport shoes provide a secondary raw material with interesting characteristics for flooring in sports facilities.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Recycling, Social impact

Title: Recovinyl- Stimulating and encouraging the use of recycled PVC
Description: Recovinyl is an initiative by the European PVC value-chain aimed at facilitating PVC waste collection and recycling under the Voluntary Commitments of Vinyl 2010 and VinylPlus®.Recovinyl’s target is to stimulate and certify the recycling of 800,000 tonnes of PVC waste by 2020 as one of the challenges set in the VinylPlus Voluntary Commitment.
Sector: B2B services, Measuring circularity, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Getting suppliers involved to better assess circularity throughout the value chain: a project by ENEL
Description: To support ENEL’s transition towards a circular economy, its Global Procurement department aims to achieve a detailed understanding of the flows of its materials (components, environmental impact and recyclability of final products) through the EDP project, which involves its suppliers' commitment.
Sector: Corporate Procurement, Measuring circularity

Title: Compaction of EPS reduces its storage and transport costs, reducing pre-recycling burden for the industry
Description: Compaction of expanded polystyrene reduces its storage and transportation costs before being sent for recycling. A compaction plant, owned by AIPE, is given for free to member firms to use.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Futur-E: 23 Italian thermoelectric power plants will get a new life, in consultation with local stakeholders and communities
Description: Enel is a prominent energy actor in Italy. As a result of its investment in renewable energy, 23 obsolete thermoelectric power plants and one mining area are to be decommissioned.The Futur-E project aims to reconvert these outdated plants into local facilities satisfying criteria of innovation, social, environmental and economic sustainability.
Sector: Governance, Housing and Urban development, Innovation and investment, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Mercato Circolare - a smartphone app searching for circular economy products, services and events
Description: Free-of-charge smartphone app to search for circular economy products, services and events.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Awareness raising, B2B services, Digital solutions, Education and skills, Empowering Consumers, Personal and household goods, Personal and household services

Title: Ultra thin White Topping: durable and resource-efficient solution for asphalt roads
Description: Ultra Thin White Topping is a road hardening innovation, applied to pilot projects in Frysland and Overijssel by Schagen Infra BV. To replace damaged asphalt sustainably, the company renovated the degenerated road surface using a thin layer of cement with polyseter fibers mixed in, thus reducing resource consumption and enabling full material recovery at end-of-life stage.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure

Title: Mater‐Biopolymer - industrial regeneration and recovery of production residues in biopolyesters industry
Description: Mater-Biopolymer is a company based in Patrica, 100% owned by Novamont, dedicated to the production of Origo-Bi, biodegradable biopolyesters of renewable origin, and to the development of new biopolymers.The industrial site is the result of the reconversion of existing infrastructures and skills of an abandoned production plant for PET. It ensures the highest quality and safety requirements.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recover, Regenerative economy, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Alisea: corporate gifts can be circular and promote your image in style
Description: It is by combining design with recycling that Alisea has found an original place on the corporate gifts market. Its range include beautiful, personalised items that thanks to innovative transformation process, include secondary raw materials such as paper, metal, textile or even graphite.
Sector: B2B services

Title: Rifò - regenerating noble textile fibers into timeless pieces of clothing
Description: Rifò regenerates noble textile fibers, such as cashmere, using a proven technology developed in the textile district of Prato (Tuscany) over a hundred years ago.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: A new pyrolysis process for ELT delivers high grade secondary raw materials at a lower environmental cost
Description: Tyrebirth has developed a new technological approach for the management of ELT (end-of-life tyres) through the production of microwave pyrolysis plants. The process uses microwaves and infrared radiation to activate the pyrolysis on the tyres, generating second raw materials with an extremely low environmental impact.
Sector: Chemical management, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Italian design with maestria: these stylish pieces of furniture are modular, repairable, recyclable
Description: Lessmore, the Italian ecodesign brand, produces and trades a collection of furnishings and accessories designed to ensure maximal repairability and recyclability, and minimal environmental impact.
Sector: Circular design, Furniture

Title: Idea Plast: decades of design and production experience bring playful new life to recycled plastics
Description: Idea Plast is an Italian company specialising in the design of plastic parts since 1987. It aims at providing clients with a full service for new plastic manufactured goods, including design, prototyping, testing and best options for end-of-life recycling.
Sector: Furniture, Housing and Urban development, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Funghi Espresso: where ideas mushroom left and right
Description: Funghi Espresso is an innovative startup that produces fresh mushrooms in a sustainable and natural way, using coffee grounds (coffee waste) from local bars and restaurants as a growing substance.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Industrial symbiosis

Title: El Ouidane: biowaste revives an oasis and keeps the desert at bay
Description: By initiating collection and composting practices into a 1500 inhabitants city district, the El Ouidane project aims to combat the desertification and to protect a fragile environment such as oases.
Organisation: AICA (Associazione Internazionale per la Comunicazione Ambientale)
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Recover, Regenerative economy, Social impact

Title: Educational Campaign in Italian Schools on waste and circular economy
Description: Everything is transformed - a new look at wasteis an educational campaign. It aims to involve students from secondary and primary schools in Italy to promote a more circular approach to waste management.
Sector: Education and skills

Title: Modular straw-based eco-modules meet economic, insulation, safety and recyclability requirements
Description: Prespaglia offers a product line of modular blocks of pressed straw for the construction sector. The modular eco-blocks are made of straw, clay and pozzolan lime, making them entirely recyclable and biodegradable.
Sector: Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure

Title: Favini pairs with Barilla to create CartaCrusca, using up bran residues from the mills
Description: TheCartaCruscaproject consists in recovering bran residues from the milling of Barilla wheat, not usable for human consumption, and subsequently processing them, together with cellulose, for the production of paper.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Industrial symbiosis, Packaging

Title: Flustix - Labelling plastic goods to support responsible consumption
Description: Flustix is a certification body for plastic-free and partially plastic-free products as well as goods made from recycled plastics. By making plastic reduction clearly visible for customers, the certification provides guidance and the opportunity to make a plastic-aware buying decision.
Sector: Empowering Consumers, Measuring circularity, Personal and household goods, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: From the production of agricultural lime to summer barbecues, olive pits make a perfect circular fuel
Description: KLIMIS has been using the woody part of Greek olive pits as heating fuel for its kiln in order to bake lime stones since 1968. In 1992, it developed a patented process to recycle the residual material from this combustion into highly-efficient, low-emission barbecue briquettes.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Love them, wear them out, wear them again: full repair service is part of this eco-responsible shoe line
Description: Kavat produces durable and high-quality shoes made of sustainable materials by resorting to eco-friendly manufacturing processes, and also offers a shoe repair service.
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: 3SIXTY Turn Recycled Plastic Bottles and Upcycled Ocean Waste Into Towels For The Hotel Industry
Description: 3SIXTY upcycled end of life, single use plastic bottles and ocean waste into towels for the hotel industry.
Sector: Culture, Sports and Leisure activities, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Biopolymer Hydal is made from waste cooking oil and is 100% recyclable
Description: NAFIGATE’s Hydal Biotechnology uses waste cooking oil to produce a fully biodegradable and biocompatible PHA biopolymer named Hydal (Polyhydroxyalcanoates). This is the first biopolymer of its kind being produced on an industrial scale at an affordable price.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Gumdrop gives chewing gum a second life
Description: Gumdrop Ltd is the first company in the world to recycle and process chewing gum into a range of products such as boots or phone covers that can be used in the rubber and plastics industry.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Recycling

Title: SK-Tex, a Slovakian recycling company, transforms old clothes into insulation products
Description: SK-Tex takes old clothing and turns it into products that can be used in cars, furniture and buildings. The company has been in operation since 1998, beginning as a textile raw materials trading company before developing into a recycling company.
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: DyeCoo uses reclaimed CO₂ as the  dyeing medium, in a closed loop process
Description: DyeCoo, based in Weesp, the Netherlands, has more than 15 years of experience in CO₂-based textile processing technology. By replacing water with CO₂ for the dyeing process, no wastewater is generated. Furthermore, DyCoo uses reclaimed CO₂ from existing idustrial processes, making it a closed loop operation.
Sector: Chemical management, Industrial symbiosis, Textiles, apparel and leather, Water

Title: C-SERVEES: Activating Circular Services in the Electric and Electronic Sector
Description: C-SERVEES is a European project that aims to boost a resource-efficient circular economy in the electrical and electronic (E&E) sector through the development, testing, validation and transfer of new circular economic business models based on systemic eco-innovative services.
Sector: B2B services, Digital solutions, Electronics and ICT, Product as a Service

Title: Di-Plast: developing digital quality control for recyclate PM material flow
Description: Use of recycled plastic material (rPM) in North West Europe is homogeneously low. In packaging and building, the highest plastic-consuming sectors, only 8% of plastic employed is recyclate (Plastics Europe 2016). The Interreg NWE research project Di-Plast develops digital technology to enable complete documentation and quality assurance of recycled plastic material flows.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Chemical management, Digital solutions, Measuring circularity, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Overcoming challenges to recycle EPS fish boxes into new food-grade packaging
Description: The LIFE EPS SURE project aims to offer a technically, environmentally and economically viable solution that allows EPS fish boxes to be collected, washed and converted into new PS food contact packaging, thus closing the loop.
Key Area: Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: AquaponieBXL: wasteless urban farming, where food grows on water using nutrients from fish waste
Description: AquaponieBxl is introducing aquaponics across Brussels by building urban farms where vegetables grow on water using fish waste as fertiliser.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Education and skills, Food, water and nutrients

Title: How recyclable is this packaging, once in consumers' hands? PREP Design makes a thorough assessment.
Description: PREP is a tool used by brand owners and packaging designers. By entering all the packaging characteristics in the platform software, a detailed report lists what happens to it when recycled by consumers and to which extent it is recyclable in real-life conditions.
Sector: Empowering Consumers, Measuring circularity

Title: ReWeee: Reducing Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment in Greece
Description: The ReWeee Project aims to prevent the creation of Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE) and to demonstrate that WEEE can be efficiently sorted and re-used.
Sector: Digital solutions, Electronics and ICT, Empowering Consumers, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Turning waste into energy by co-generation using biomass
Description: Genesis Biopartner has built a plant for the co-generation of thermal energy (heat) and mechanical energy (electricity) from biogas in Romania.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Energy and waste-to-energy, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: The Ecotic Caravan - WEEE collection and awareness campaigns
Description: The educational project Ecotic Caravan co-financed by LIFE+, ran between 2014 and 2016 and aimed to raise awareness on environmental protection and sustainable development by focusing on efficient management of WEEE waste. The caravan travelled across Romania, organized workshops with school children and was parked in the main squares so that the general public could easily interact also.
Sector: Education and skills

Title: Transforming waste into resources
Description: Green Group Holding: integrated waste management solutions for six main waste streams associated with households and SMEs (WEEE, plastics, PET, glass, lighting bulbs, cardboard) are now available in Romania as a pioneer development for South Eastern Europe via a private investment starting back in 2012.
Sector: Ceramics and Glass, Chemical management, Electronics and ICT, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Chants Libres - a pilot project combining professional furniture upcycling and social enterprise
Description: Atelier Extramuros is a social enterprise specialised in upcycling in the furniture sector, using reclaimed material from discarded professional furniture.Chants Libresis a new pilot project aiming at improving recycled material sourcing - with the support of Valdelia - and designing protoypes for the professional furnishing sector.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Furniture, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Social Enterprise, Social impact

Title: Circular cement: processing waste to create cement in a circular economy
Description: Every year, 2.5 billion tonnes of waste is produced in Europe. Thanks to its production process, the cement industry is able to use waste both as a fuel source and for secondary mineral materials.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: The 48er-Tandler Re-use Shop – A Waste Prevention and Re-use Initiative of the City of Vienna
Description: Vienna's Municipal Department 48, responsible for the city's waste management, has been active in re-use since 1989, when the city’s first re-use shop was founded. In Summer 2015, the Department opened the 48-er Tandler: a mobile re-use shop where citizens can buy affordable, quality second-hand goods and whose proceeds go entirely to charity.
Organisation: City of Vienna – Municipal Department 48 – Waste Management, Street Cleaning and Vehicle Fleet
Sector: Public services, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Virtuous recycling of end-of-life tyres by Ecopneus
Description: Ecopneus is a non-profit consortium company consisting of the largest tyre manufacturers in Italy. It currently handles 70% of the tyres that reach the end of their life-cycles.
Sector: Chemical management, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Ecoplasteam recycles multi-layer packaging integrally to produce EcoAllene
Description: Ecoplasteam has created a new plastic material - EcoAllene™​ - integrally recycled, this material contains two of the three layers - paper, polyethylene and aluminium - of "tetrapak" packaging.
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Providing those in need with the food we waste - Food Waste Cluj is leading the pack on socio-circular innovation in Romania
Description: Food Waste Combat Cluj is one of the first multi-stakeholder initiatives combating food loss and food waste in Romania. Working in partnership, local environmental associations and municipal authorities have been able to set up an infrastructure that collects excess food from the food and drinks industry and transports this to social NGOs helping out people in need.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Social impact

Title: By experimenting with recycled water bottles as material for internal components, Océ discovered the drivers and barriers to using recycled plastic in manufacturing
Description: In designing the varioPrint 135, Océ partnered with the Netherlands Enterprise Agency and Philips to experiment with the use of recycled plastic in the production of industrial printers. The company has made a further step towards circular economy and succeeded in developing an internal component that contains at least 30% post-consumer recycled polycarbonate.
Sector: B2B services, Machinery and Equipment, Research

Title: Orange Fiber squeezes orange peel into versatile, biodegradable textile
Description: Orange Fiber has closed the loop for oranges by patenting a technique to squeeze orange peel and citrus waste into cellulose fibre. With growing demand for sustainable fashion, the company is well placed to commence production in 2019, having already prototyped a collection with Salvatore Ferragamo and won the Global Change Awars
Sector: Industrial symbiosis, Textiles, apparel and leather, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Pura's Blue Right: cleaning with purely circular products
Description: The Pura Production Group is clearly committed to sustainable production. Pura's flagship Blue Right line for hotels and offices is a circular economy front runner: the floor, interior, sanitary and kitchen cleaners are produced without hazardous chemicals, sold in portion-controlled compostable packaging and lead to zero waste after use.
Sector: B2B services, Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Compastor Technology: composting in a different way
Description: Composting is the most natural method to create fertilisers, but not many people use it as it's a slow and complex process. To encourage composting, Compastor Technology has bred a genuine composting worm. When this worm is combined with a compost inoculant, green and organic waste is turned into fertiliser quickly and efficiently while using fully natural ingredients.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry

Title: Elak Electronics sells online, but hasn't bought any packaging since 2017
Description: Elak is a family-run electronics store in Brussels which has adopted a circular approach to its e-commerce activities from the onset.
Sector: Packaging, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: Functional economy: you don't need to own a Fairphone to enjoy its durability
Description: Commown is a French cooperative that offers 'Hardware as as Service (HaaS)' for Fairphones and personal computers.
Sector: Electronics and ICT, Personal and household goods, Product as a Service

Title: Kierrätyskeskus: a growing chain of big box re-use stores across Helsinki
Description: Kierrätyskeskus is a growing chain of seven big box re-use stores, selling all possible furniture, household items and craft supplies in the Helsinki area.
Sector: Education and skills, Empowering Consumers, Retail, Reuse

Title: Favini's upcycled ecological papers: Shiro Alga Carta, tackles harmful algae
Description: Shiro Alga Carta paper, patented by Favini in the ’90s, is the pioneer in their upcycling ecological paper range. It uses algae from the Venice lagoon, whose proliferation would put at risk the lagoon’s fragile ecosystem.
Sector: Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI)

Title: Favini's upcycled ecological papers: Remake, the soft touch of leather
Description: Remake is the most recent addition to Favini's upcycling ecological paper range, using as much as 25% of pulp material from discarded residue of the leather manufacturing process. This revolutionary process has won the European Paper Recycling Awards.
Sector: Industrial symbiosis, Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI)

Title: Favini's upcycled ecological papers: Crush, uses by-products from the food industry
Description: Crush, launched in 2012, is the second product in Favini's upcycling ecological paper range. Its production uses the equivalent of 15% of virgin pulp paper in by-products from food industry.
Sector: Industrial symbiosis, Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI)

Title: Automotive industry: plastic recyclates offering prime-like performances in new parts
Description: WIPAG recycles post-industrial and post-consumer plastic waste from several industries with its main focus on automotive parts. Both composite separation and de-coating process allow for end products with excellent performances.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Ballymun's boiler house is now a 3D textbook on reuse
Description: When Dublin's Ballymun suburb was scheduled for regeneration, a local environmental project redeveloped the neighbourhood's heating plant into a 3D textbook on repair, reuse and refurbish. The Rediscovery Centre, housed in the old boiler house, is now a cutting-edge creative space connecting people, resources and ideas that includes four social enterprises.
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Education and skills, Housing and Urban development, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Social Enterprise, Social impact

Title: Desso is Cradle-to-Cradle certified throughout its production chain
Description: Desso is specialised in producing commercial/residential carpets and artificial turf for sports fields according to the Cradle to Cradle® principles.
Sector: Furniture, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: ReStart® Programme at Tarkett
Description: Tarkett, a world-wideleader of innovative flooring and sports surface solutions, has introduced a take-back Restart® programme in Europe and North America to collect flooring, which then is sorted and selected as a source of quality raw materials to be used in Tarkett's own production process.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: B2B services, Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Corporate Procurement, Recycling

Title: Wiltz - a Circular Economy Hotspot in the heart of Ardennes
Description: In October 2015 the Luxembourg government named the municipality of Wiltz a Circular Economy Hotspot.  In February 2018 Wiltz renewed its political commitment with a Circular Economy Charter signed by its municipal council, by which it committed itself to mainstreaming circular economy in its future project and activities.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Public services, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: SuperDrecksKëscht® for a sound treatment of available raw material and energy sources
Description: SuperDrecksKëscht®promotes the creation of an environment-friendly society that protects its energy and resources, as part of the Luxembourg waste management strategy.
Sector: Awareness raising, Empowering Consumers, Recycling

Title: Luxembourg at the forefront of WEEE processing in Europe
Description: Ecotrel is the waste electrical and electronic equipment (EEE) recycling association for all of Luxembourg which has recently launched a "circularity and solidarity cluster" of business and social enterprises. These take back WEEE in order to re-use, disassemble or recycle it, and also to delete the personal data still stored in electronic waste.
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Electronics and ICT, Empowering Consumers

Title: Luxembourg's Climate Pact now also mainstreams circular economy in local policy
Description: The Climate Pact, which was set up by Luxembourg's Ministry of Sustainable Development and Infrastructure in order to enable municipalities wishing to actively tackle climate change to request State support by signing an engagement charter, now includes measures on circular economy.
Organisation: Ministry of Sustainable Development and Infrastructure
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Innovation and investments
Sector: Governance, Public procurement, Public services

Title: Wastly facilitates marketing of secondary raw materials thanks to its BtoB online platform
Description: Wastly is a B2B online platform for the marketing of secondary raw materials (SRM) resulting from waste recovery and recycling.
Sector: B2B services, Digital solutions, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Fairphone created the world's first ethical, modular smartphone
Description: The Fairphone 3, launched in 2019, is one of the first modular smartphones, with components designed for longer use first and refurbishment when they finally break down.
Sector: Circular design, Electronics and ICT

Title: Vanhulley: New products from textile waste
Description: Van Hulley is a Dutch SME that upcycles worn-out shirts into boxershorts, employing disadvantaged women as seamstresses every year and training them to join the labour market more permanently.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Clothing and Fashion industry, Education and skills, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Infinited Fiber regenerates cotton-rich textile waste into brand-new Infinna™ textile fibers
Description: Infinited Fiber has developed a process technology that can turn cotton rich textile waste into new fibers for the textile industry. Not just once, but infinitely. These new Infinna™ textile fibers can be recycled again and again without decreasing the quality of the fiber.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Industrial techniques, Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: ShareWear showed 340,000 consumers fashion can be borrowed, not only bought
Description: ShareWear, a part of the Swedish Democreativity initiative, was launched to inspire a sustainable way to be fashionable. A ready-to-share collection with Swedish fashion items allowed consumers to borrow unique clothing - but only if they shared it forward.
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Personal and household goods, Product as a Service

Title: Ghent's circular approach is turning its Old Dockyards brownfield into waterfront housing
Description: In Ghent, Belgium, the circular economy brings together companies, institutions, governments and citizens on the way to sustainability. The Old Dockyards is a waterfront housing project where closing loops at the district level is key. Approximately 1,500 housing units will be constructed through public-private partnerships (PPPs).
Sector: Empowering Consumers, Housing and Urban development, Public services, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: The Saint-Gobain Gypsum Activity at the head of Circular Economy
Description: Taking advantage of the eternal recyclability of Gypsum, Saint-Gobain's gypsum subsidiary already launched a voluntary and ambitious policy in 2000 to encourage the recycling of pre- and post-consumer gypsum waste.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure

Title: Saint-Gobain's ISOVER is a pioneer in recycling glass wool
Description: Glass wool is infinitely and completely recyclable. Regardless of the glass wool’s quality, age, density or other properties, the material is entirely recyclable and can be re-melted as many times as necessary, before entering into the composition of new insulating products, without having its final quality impacted.
Sector: B2B services, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Recycling

Title: Water2REturn turns wastewater into added-value agricultural products
Description: Water2REturn is an Innovation Action co-funded by the European Commission under its Horizon 2020 (H2020) programme.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Food, water and nutrients, Industrial symbiosis, Recover, Regenerative economy

Title: Kalundborg Symbiosis: six decades of a circular approach to production
Description: Kalundborg Symbiosis is a partnership between nine public and private companies in Kalundborg, Denmark.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Industrial symbiosis, Pharmaceuticals, Power and utilities, Recycling, Refineries

Title: Metsä Group’s bioproduct mill in Äänekoski, Finland, leads the way towards a carbon neutral society
Description: Metsä Group built the first next-generation bioproduct mill in Äänekoski, Finland – the largest investment of the European forest industry with the value of EUR 1.2 billion. The new mill, which began operations in the third quarter of 2017, leads the industry to a new era of resource efficiency through operating completely with no fossil fuels or fossil CO2emissions.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry

Title: UpCycle City contest - City of Almere
Description: The municipality of Almere aspires to become a waste-free and energy-neutral city by 2022. The administration wants to bring the business community and knowledge institutes’ innovative power together to enable co-creation in the field of waste management and upcycling in the urban context.
Key Area: Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Governance, Public services, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: London Waste and Recycling is delivering on the circular economy with stakeholder buy-in
Description: London is among one the world’s most cosmopolitan and oldest cities, and one of the most cosmopolitan. As Britain’s largest city and country’s economic, transportation and cultural capital, over 8 million people live in London. A more flexible and sustainable approach to products, housing, office space and critical infrastructure is crucial to London’s ability to adapt and grow.
Sector: Public services, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: From waste to resources: Genoa looks ahead to a circular economy
Description: Genoa set itself an objective to close the loop on waste materials by taking advantage of treatment plants in the city's immediate vicinity. By adopting a long-term and territorially integrated approach, the city intends to achieve higher recycling rates within five years and strengthen the circular economy locally.
Sector: Public services, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Industrial territorial ecology improves energy efficiency for the Port of Strasbourg
Description: With half a million inhabitants, the ‘Eurométropole’ of Strasbourg is a collection of 33 municipalities and represents a centre of activity in the east of France. Deeply committed to energy transition, the Eurométropole adopted a climate plan in 2009 aimed at energy savings, the reduction of greenhouse gas (GHG) emission and the development of renewable energies.
Sector: Energy and waste-to-energy, Housing and Urban development, Industrial symbiosis, Public services

Title: Ljubljana turned invasive plants into recycled paper
Description: Ljubljana is faced with significant overgrowth of Japanese knotweed, a plant on the list of 100 most invasive non-native species worldwide. Ljubljana teamed up with the Re-generacija collective of young designers and architects focused on issues connected to social and environmental well-being, as well as some other stakeholders, to prevent excessive overgrowth of the plant and reuse it.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI), Recycling

Title: Utrecht used recycled asphalt for the Cremerstraat cycle lane to reduce resource input
Description: Utrecht, one of the four biggest cities in the Netherlands, aims to be climate neutral in 2030 and to reach a fully circular economy by 2050. In a shorter term, Utrecht is committed to increasing its share of circular procurement from 4% of the annual spend in 2016 to 10% by 2020. Utrecht’s sustainable vision is also reflected in its aspiration to become the most bike-friendly city in the world.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Public services, Recycling

Title: Sfridoo enables manufacturers to purchase and sell industrial scraps
Description: Sfridoo.com is an Italian B2B publishing platform for purchasing and selling scrap materials. Using sharing economy princples to turn the circular economy into a reality, Sfridoo has already enabled more than 100 businesses to recycle and reuse industrial scraps.
Sector: B2B services, Digital solutions, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Lyon Metropole regenerates brownsites into fertile ground
Description: Lyon Métropole, which includes 59 municipalities and 1 300 000 inhabitants, wants to build a sustainable future for its citizens. The Métropole relies on green investments to face environmental challenges. Lyon is also committed to building circular solutions for the region and has been recognised as a ‘zero waste territory’ (territoire zéro déchet, zéro gaspillage) since 2015.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Chemical management, Public services, Recover, Regenerative economy, Soils, soil improvement and restoration

Title: Oslo takes an integrated approach to treat waste into circular bio-resources
Description: Oslo has been developing a waste management system based on circular principles to ensure separate waste collection is maximised and transform waste into secondary raw materials. To do so it has actively engaged with citizens, farmers as well as with its city’s public transportation company.
Sector: Empowering Consumers, Public services, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Turin spurs social inclusion with projects reducing food waste and increasing recycling
Description: Facing dramatic deindustrialisation and an uncertain future, the city of Turin implemented processes that paired physical redevelopment with strategic planning to promote citywide revitalisation and economic restructuring in the 1990s. While the transformation has been profound, current challenges call for more circular strategies and an inclusive approach.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Public services, Social impact, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Munich develops a secondhand store to kickstart its local circular economy
Description: Munich has taken its ambitious waste reduction strategy to the next level by developing an innovative reuse lab and shop concept. Its Halle 2 municipal secondhand store not only enables citizens to take responsibility for living more sustainably, it also provides opportunities for job creation, educational programmes and voluntary activities.
Sector: Public services, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Reuse, Social Enterprise, Social impact

Title: Dusseldorf is moving towards sustainable procurement with recycled office paper
Description: As a densely populated and economically powerful urban area, the city of Dusseldorf recognised the challenge of climate change early on and initiated a process of low carbon and zero waste strategy development.
Sector: Public procurement, Public services

Title: Amsterdam is going Circular smartly with 'learning by doing'
Description: In 2015, Amsterdam commissioned an in-depth study on the potential of a circular economy. The project was the first large-scale research study in the world that uses the ‘city circle scan’ methodology. The scan identifies the areas in which the most significant, tangible progress in realising a circular economy can be achieved.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Public services, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Birmingham is working to reduce emissions and waste through Industrial Symbiosis
Description: Birmingham is Britain’s youngest and fastest growing city having also the strongest economy outside the capital and being one of the first cities to adopt a proactive industrial symbiosis approach to develop a medium and long-term strategy for sustainable economic development. The projects born from the industrial symbiosis approach are part of Birmingham’s circular economy strategy.
Sector: Industrial symbiosis, Public services

Title: 3R pyrolysis technology converts un-exploited biomass resources into bio-phosphate
Description: Terra Humana's 3R zero emission pyrolysis and nutrient recovery technology transform animal by-products into safe and high value Bio-Phosphate fertiliser.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Food, water and nutrients, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: GPP-Furniture - An open learning resource on Green Public Procurement for the furniture industry
Description: GPP-FURNITURE, European project funded by the Erasmus+ programme, has for objective the development of an innovative e-training program for professionals of the furniture and habitat sector in the field of furniture production and design that meets the new environmental requirements known as Green Public Procurement (GPP).
Sector: Education and skills, Furniture, Public procurement

Title: Renuevas: a Ecoembes-Danone collaboration to increase away-from-home recycling rates
Description: The ReNueva project of Aguas Danone has been launched todevelop its commitment to recycling and reusing plastics, with funding from the Danone Ecosystem Fund; a fund created by Danone at a global level. It aims at increasing recycling in the away-from-home market, while simultaneously training and creating jobs for disabled or socially excluded people.
Sector: Empowering Consumers, Social Enterprise

Title: PerForm Water 2030 - redesigning water infrastructure for efficiency and circularity
Description: The PerFORM WATER 2030 project will cover the following 4 main thematic areas and will focus on different study activities and pilots (TRL 4 to 7) implementation:Water pathwayBiosolids valorization pathwayMaterial and energy recovery pathwayEconomic sustainability and social acceptability of new technologies.
Sector: Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Paperchain: New market niches for the PPI waste in construction, mining and chemical sectors
Description: The overall objective of PAPERCHAIN is to deploy five novel circular economy models centred in the valorisation of the waste streams generated by the Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI)
Sector: Industrial symbiosis, Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI), Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Bresso:enhancement of biomethane upgrade from sewage sludge by algae valorization
Description: CAP HOLDING, at the Bresso/Niguarda wastewater plant, has installed two sewage sludge biomethane upgrade plants, one based on membrane technology and the other on zeolite filtration. The ultimate aim of the project is to evaluate the technical feasibility of biomethane production from sewage sludge accordingly to CEN standards.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Citizen participation and circular economy: a Pilot project in the City Hall of Valladolid
Description: Programme of action for the development of a local circular economy strategy.
Sector: Empowering Consumers, Social impact

Title: Circular Procurement: Green Deal Circulair Aankopen - Vlaanderen Circulair
Description: Together with a number of partner organisations, Circular Flanders and the Government of the Region of Flanders launched the Green Deal for Circular Procurement (GDCP) on 8 June 2017. Some 130 companies, local authorities and non-profit organisations took part in this landmark event.
Sector: Corporate Procurement, Public procurement

Title: Development of deconstruction wood waste use as energy recovery in cement plants
Description: French cement producers plan to increase alternative fuels use from 44% of the fuel mix to 50%, by 2025. To support this initiative, they aim, in collaboration with construction and recycling trade organisations, to double the amount of wood waste used in the energy supply of cement plants.
Organisation: SFIC - Syndicat Français de l'Industrie Cimentière
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Circular action for climate neutrality

Title: Clothes are moving fast in fashion retail, but a re-use and recycle scheme keeps hangers in the loop
Description: Braiform is a global leader in garment hanger reuse. Products are returned to reuse centres where they are sorted, repackaged and distributed back to garment-producing regions, preventing them from ending up in landfill.
Sector: B2B services, Product as a Service, Retail

Title: Make the most of these beets: increasing diversity and building resilience in the sugar industry
Description: There are plenty of hot startups with a new technology that can accelerate the transition to a circular economy.Yet some of the best examples rely on the gradual evolution of processes and a precise understanding of energy and resource flows. Continual improvement, collaboration and systems thinking are very much on display at the BritishSugar’s Factoryin Norfolk.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients

Title: Smart proteins saving our seas: black soldier flies convert waste into high quality food for aquaculture
Description: The Need- a huge volume of organic waste is generated each year. At the same time there is a growing demand for high quality protein in the animal feed and aquaculture sectors.The Solution- by using the remarkable nutrient-recycling capacity of the black soldier fly larvae, organic waste can be converted into high quality protein in a very short time period.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Food, water and nutrients

Title: Do we have waste in 2030? - The role of municipalities in the transition to a circular economy
Description: The purpose of the project has been to highlight the possibilities the municipalities and regions have to accommodate a more circular economy in the future.
Organisation: The Norwegian Association of Local and Regional Authorities
Key Area: Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Governance, Public services

Title: HNST - Radically different denim (recycled denim fibres)
Description: In September 2017, HNST (pronounce as “honest”) had a collection campaign where people could drop off their old and unworn denims at more than 80 collecting points in Flanders (Belgium).
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Recycling

Title: PET to PET Reycling:The bottle-to-bottle loop
Description: In operation since 2007, PET to PET Recycling Österreich GmbH focuses on the production of food-grade recycled PET, which is used for “bottle-to-bottle recycling”, a globally unique and resource-efficient recycling loop in which old PET bottles are turned into new ones.
Organisation: PET to PET Reycling Österreich GmbH
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Recycling is easy in Italy: Just a click away with Junker
Description: "Junker" is an app which recognises products with a single click on their barcode, and provides people with all the information they need to recycle their components correctly and quickly. It makes waste disposal easy, thanks to the Internet of Things and user crowdsourcing.
Sector: Digital solutions, Empowering Consumers, Recycling

Title: Re-use before recycling of laser printer cartridges
Description: Printer cartridges are seen as a single-use product by printer and cartridge Original Equipment Manufacturers. However, most of today’s printer cartridges fall within the scope of the WEEE-2 directive.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Machinery and Equipment, Reuse

Title: Granada biorefinery – A 100% circular facility
Description: The Granada Sur Biorefinery of Emasagra has set up an ambitious environmental strategy in order to become European circular economy reference in the field of sanitation and wastewater treatment.
Sector: Public services, Refineries, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: CenBio - Enabling sustainable and cost-efficient bioenergy in Norway
Description: CenBio - Bioenergy Innovation Centre is one of Norway’s Centres for Environment-friendly Energy Research.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Energy and waste-to-energy

Title: ROCKWOOL stone wool solutions: How upcycling transforms waste into value
Description: Stone wool can be recycled again and again into new stone wool.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Recycling

Title: Circular comfortable furniture, made from recovered (ocean) plastics
Description: The company Van de Sant Innovations BV designs and manufactures comfortable sustainable furniture, made fromrecovered (ocean) plastics.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Furniture, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Circular Business Models for carpet tiles – Creating a climate fit for life
Description: In 1994, the carpet tiles company Interface made a public commitment to become restorative by 2020, eliminating any negative impact the company might have. As 2020 approaches and the organisation is on track, working towards 100% renewable energy in production, 100% recycled and biobased materials, having reuse and recycling options available around the globe.
Sector: Circular design, Furniture

Title: Co-processing of waste in EU cement plants: status and prospects
Description: The EU cement industry supports the promotion of industrial symbiosis and the recognition of energy recovery as a waste management solution for non-recyclable waste. The use of waste materials in the cement industry with a simultaneous energy recovery and material recycling, referred to as co-processing, contributes towards achieving the objectives of the circular economy.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Energy and waste-to-energy, Industrial symbiosis, Recycling

Title: Circular Computing - creating a more ethical, sustainable and socially responsible way to buy enterprise IT
Description: Circular Computing exists to create a more ethical, sustainable and socially responsible way to buy enterprise IT.
Sector: B2B services, Electronics and ICT, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Volpy brings smartphones into the circular economy
Description: Volpy is an all-in-one ethical and environmental innovation on the smartphone market: customers can have their smartphones valued, return them and exchange with others directly through an app.
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Electronics and ICT, Empowering Consumers, Recycling

Title: Boosting the Circular Economy through public procurement
Description: The Catalan Government considers that public procurement should be used as an instrument to support strategic policies in the transition towards CE.
Organisation: Directorate-General for Environmental Quality and Climate Change Government of Catalonia
Sector: Governance, Public procurement

Title: RE-Salt initiative: Recycling of industrial salty process water
Description: After several years of research, a pilot plant has been constructed and gone into operation within Covestro’s project Cycles (funded by German Federal Ministry of Environment BMUB), to demonstrate the reuse of low-concentrated salt-containing wastewater streams.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Chemical management, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Herman Miller are Closing the Loop on Wood Waste
Description: Offcuts and wood waste generated during production at the Herman Miller production facility in Wiltshire is collected and delivered to Timberpak, utilising empty vehicle space and back loading to minimise their environmental footprint.
Sector: Furniture, Industrial symbiosis, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Mattresses re-designed for re-use and recycling
Description: Production of organic, natural, luxury mattresses, toppers and bedding, using 100% biodegradable material wherever possible.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Furniture, Personal and household goods

Title: FISSAC project - a new Industrial Symbiosis model for the Construction industry
Description: The FISSAC project involves stakeholders at all levels of the construction and demolition value chain to develop a methodology and software platform, to facilitate information exchange, that can support industrial symbiosis networks and replicate pilot schemes at local and regional levels.
Sector: Digital solutions, Industrial symbiosis, Research

Title: Waste compensation: Closing the Loop of electronics' lifecycle
Description: Since 2011Closing the Loop(CTL) has been proving a successful waste compensation model. It has developed a unique approach in which customers pay to compensate for the purchase of new electronic devices, and the fee is used to collect scrap mobile phones and batteries with CTL's long-term networks in Africa for responsible recycling in Europe.
Sector: B2B services, Electronics and ICT, Recycling

Title: Cement industry: protecting natural resources by reusing alternative materials
Description: The use of alternative resources has a long tradition in the Austrian Cement Industry. The success story originally started with the processing of alternative main constituents for cement production. The recent trend reaches out further for the substitution of natural raw materials for the clinker production. For every ton of cement, almost 500 kg of alternative resources have been reused.
Organisation: Association of the Austrian Cement Industry
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Alternatives to single-use plastic bags in Morocco
Description: SCP/RAC promotes an action in Morocco to support the country in transitioning from single-use plastic bags to other green means.
Organisation: Regional Activity Centre for Sustainable Consumption and Production (SCP/RAC)
Sector: Empowering Consumers, Social impact

Title: SwitchMed Green Entrepreneurship Programme
Description: The EU-funded SwitchMed Programme supports and connects stakeholders to scale-up social and eco-innovations in the Mediterranean. It promotes inclusive growth, job creation and sustainable development by supporting policy makers, eco-innovative small and medium sized enterprises, industries, start-ups and entrepreneurs in the Southern Mediterranean countries.
