Country: Other (Algeria, Egypt, Israel, Jordan, Lebanon, Morocco, Palestine, Tunisia)
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Business incubators, Startups, Public procurement, Social impact

Title: DGNB certification provides bonuses for applying circular economy principles in sustainable construction
Description: The German Sustainable Building Council (DGNB) is a central knowledge platform for sustainable building and provides the world’s most advanced sustainable building certification system which makes Circular Economy aspects measurable and assessable.
Organisation: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Nachhaltiges Bauen – DGNB e.V. (German Sustainable Building Council)
Key Area: Production, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Measuring circularity

Title: A populated circular city set up on the site of a 12.000m2 abandoned swimming pool
Description: BlueCity creates a much needed tangible and inspiring example for the circular economy, closing the loops and building the city and the economy of the future. Set in a deserted swimming pool, this dynamic community of circular entrepreneurs, researchers, government and education representatives serves as a breeding ground for 25+ innovative, circular companies linking their waste-streams.
Sector: Business incubators, Startups, Housing and Urban development, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Ecopixel: Recycled and Recyclable Plastic
Description: Collecting, reusing or recycling plastic (*LDPE) trash, stepping up the use of recycled plastic and modifying product designs to minimize new plastic use. Ecopixel aims to keep the material pure so that also after this cycle it can be recycled a third or fourth time and so on ...
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Repair Network Vienna
Description: Increasing the demand for repair services and networking for repairing companies.
Sector: Public services, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Towards circular economy in the plastic packaging value chain
Description: CIRCPACK project aims at more sustainable, efficient, competitive, integrated and interconnected plastic packaging value chain with less fossil fuel dependence.
Organisation: CIRCE Foundation - Research Centre for Energy Resources and Consumption
Key Area: Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Toss it in the bin: anti-littering-initiative by Altstoff Recycling Austria
Description: Founded in 2012‚ "Reinwerfen statt Wegwerfen" is a voluntary initiative of Austrian businesses, based on an agreement between Austrian social partners and the Federal Ministry of Sustainability and Tourism to improve the ecological performance of packaging by creating public awareness, preventing and reducing littering and promoting the separate collection and recycling of packaging.
Sector: Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Empowering Consumers, Packaging, Recycling, Refuse, Re-think, Reduce

Title: Solidarity Computers Initiative
Description: The Solidarity Computers initiative aims to extend the useful life of IT equipment that no longer meets the requirements for use. This can be reused by employees for their personal use by buying it for a symbolic fee, or donated to NGOs or to other external entities.
Sector: Electronics and ICT, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Social impact

Title: From steel production waste gases to electricity
Description: The integration of the steel sector into the electricity generation cycle is an example of collaboration between companies from different sectors significantly minimising the environmental impact of their facilities. This integration allows the steel production gases produced by the industrial processes of steel plants to be transferred to an electric company for use as additional fuel.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Circular action for climate neutrality

Title: Cement recarbonation
Description: Cement recarbonation refers to the process where part of the CO2emitted during the cement production is re-absorbed by concrete in use through carbonation.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Circular action for climate neutrality, Industrial techniques

Title: ProofPositive Tile: Creating a climate fit for life
Description: Every day plants pull carbon out of the atmosphere through photosynthesis but release it when they decompose. Interface has taken specifically selected plant-derived carbon and converted it into a durable material that stores that carbon for at least a generation. The carbon is stored in the materials that make up the Proof Positive tile.
Sector: Circular design, Furniture

Title: Biobased substrate compost: a high quality circular ingredient for potting soil
Description: Attero introduces a new high quality product that is used as ingredient for substrates and potting soils: biobased substrate compost. The process for achieving this quality is unique in the world of compost production.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Circular action for climate neutrality, Personal and household goods

Title: Extra life for high-end audio products
Description: Good repair services and upgrade options for end users or manufacturers in Europe provide a longer life option for all high-end audio products manufactured and distributed by the members of the High End Society e.V.
Sector: Personal and household goods, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose

Title: Ingredients for a Circular Economy
Description: Food and drink manufacturers work continuously to preserve the value of resources that go into food and drink products during the manufacturing process. The website Ingredients for a circular economy presents through concrete examples what manufacturers do to move towards a more circular economy: for instance, striving to preserve the value of resources such as water, energy and materials.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Food, water and nutrients

Title: SwitchMed - MED TEST II
Description: Skaff Dairy Farm is a small-sized enterprise producing around 840 t of dairy products annually for the local market. Skaff Dairy Farm joined the MED TEST II project in order to improve quality and reduce defects, to drive out waste and continuously improve cost efficiency. The main problems the company faced was energy and finished products losses.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Awareness raising, Behavioural incentives, Energy and waste-to-energy, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Green sinks substitute organic raw materials and  mineral fillers with recycled materials
Description: The aim of LIFE GREEN SINKS project was to create a new "green" range of products, represented by innovative kitchen sinks manufactured by 100% recovered materials.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Furniture, Recycling

Title: RCYCL
Description: The LIFE project RCYCL (LIFE99 ENV/B/000640) set up a scheme for the collection and reuse of bulky waste in municipalities of Belgium’s German-speaking community and the region of Verviers, under the auspices of a social enterprise.
Organisation: RCYCL asbl – Collecte d’encombrants ménagers & centre de tri
Sector: Personal and household services, Public services, Social Enterprise, Social impact, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: From construction waste to construction material: progressive recycled wood stone
Description: Destaclean® Puukivi (Wood stone) is a progressive recycled material, of which the prepared products are ecological, lightweight, durable and easy to machine. The resulting wood stone is a composite of pure recycled wood fibre, rock minerals, cement and water.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Reuse and recycling of loading pallets
Description: Every year, two million renovated pallets do another tour in serving the industry. Wooden pallets can be reused again and again, and eventually a worn-out pallet will be utilised as energy for heating.
Sector: Recycling

Title: New, innovative bioenergy products from paper and pulp mills’ sidestreams utilizing novel biogas technology
Description: EcoEnergySF Oy has a biogas plant in the area of Metsä Fibre Bioproduct Mill in Äänekoski, Finland. The biogas plant processes the wastewater slurries of the BioproductMill, and turn those into biogas for transportation, carbon dioxide for pulping process as well as fertilizers and solid biofuel for boiler plants.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Energy and waste-to-energy, Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI), Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Traditional Christmas ham goes circular with the HamTrick campaign (Kinkkutemppu)
Description: The Ham trick (kinkkutemppuin Finnish) is a consumer campaign organised in 2016 and 2017 in Finland during the Christmas period.This cross-sectoral co-operation with Finnish companies and organisations aimed at bringing the concept of circular economy closer to consumers,  advising about recycling and avoiding that the drains were choked by excess fat at Christmas.
Organisation: Co-operation project co-ordinated by the Chemical Industry Federation of Finland
Sector: Empowering Consumers, Recycling

Title: Geocycle gives second life to C&DW through the cement manufacturing process
Description: The cement industry and LafargeHolcim under the Geocycle brand, have developed strong expertise in coprocessing. This latter refers to the simultaneous recovery of energy and the recycling of mineral materials within one single industrial process: cement manufacturing. This waste treatment solution allows 100% of the material input to be recovered or recycled in the production process.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Energy and waste-to-energy, Recycling

Title: A circular furniture system
Description: Arcadia Design envisions a design that changes as its owners does.
Sector: Circular design, Furniture

Title: Giving plastic bottles a second life through “Bottle-to-Bottle” in Rostock
Description: Every year in Rostock, Veolia converts 1 billion PET drinks bottles into so-called recyclate from which preforms/bottles can again be manufactured.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Turning coffee by-product into green energy
Description: This joint venture is a successful and genuine example of a short circuit circular loop where Veolia and Jacobs Douwe Egberts developed a solution to use spent coffee grounds from the plant’s production process to produce steam.
Key Area: Production, Consumption, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Energy and waste-to-energy, Food, water and nutrients, Industrial symbiosis, Industrial techniques

Title: The road to a circular future: the realizations and the challenges
Description: Denuo is the Belgian umbrella association for private companies who put the circular economy at the heart of their operations. It represents 220 companies who are helping enterprises across all sectors to fundamentally change their production processes, making the transition towards the circular economy, and also including manufacturing companies who use circular economy principles.
Sector: Recycling

Title: From expired bank cards to urban furniture
Description: Caixa identified the development of a recycling circuit for expired or damaged cards as an opportunity for improvement: bank cards (expired or at the end of their service lives) and non-bank cards (for example, loyalty cards made of plastic) are valued through plastic recycling.
Sector: Furniture, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling, Reuse, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Attero InfiniteFilm: high-end post-consumer film recycling
Description: 24 Kton annualy will be converted into LDPE re-granulate in the new recycling factory Attero is building in Wijster. Contaminated film is cleaned and turned into a high quality and odorless re-granulate.
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: ReMade in Italy: how to measure the circularity in a product
Description: ReMade in Italy® is the first certification scheme accredited in Italy to verify the content of recycled materials in a product.
Sector: Measuring circularity

Title: Social Innovation Repair - Giving a second life to electrical and electronic appliances, the R.U.S.Z case
Description: Following the business model of a sustainable repair shop, R.U.S.Z is a social business which started back in 1998, as a work integration social enterprise for long-term unemployed persons.
Organisation: Reparatur- und Service-Zentrum R.U.S.Z / Repair and Service Centre R.U.S.Z
Sector: Personal and household goods, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Social Enterprise, Social impact

Title: ELIPSE : le référentiel pour l'évaluation des performances des démarches d'écologie industrielle et territoriale (EIT)
Description: Le référentiel ELIPSE est un outil qui permet d’assurer l’évaluation et le suivi des démarches d’écologie industrielle et territoriale (EIT).
Sector: N/A

Title: Stories of Circular Economy: an Italian Atlas and a competition.
Description: Stories of Circular Economy combines the first online Atlas gathering circular economy experiences in Italy with an annual competition.
Organisation: ECODOM - Italian Household Appliance Recovery and Recycling Consortium
Sector: B2B services, Digital solutions

Title: Zero Carbon Resorts project towards Sustainable Development of the Tourism Sector in the Philippines and Thailand
Description: Tourism in the Philippines and Thailand is receiving increasing attention as an excellent development option but with the vulnerability of developing countries to climate change it is inevitable to take the environmental performance of the tourism business into serious consideration.
Sector: Circular action for climate neutrality, Culture, Sports and Leisure activities

Title: 88 000 tons of safe and quality food redistributed to 8 035 charitable organizations in 2017
Description: With the help of a network of 21 Food Banks across the country, FBAO recovers surplus food and redistributes it to charitable organizations which assist people in need.
Sector: Food, water and nutrients, Social impact

Title: Close the loop in ceramic industry
Description: In circular economy secondary resources (i.e. end-of-life products), the industrial side streams and wastes, are the “wasted resources of today”, if they are not utilized and returned for use.
Organisation: Chemical and Construction Materials Technology Laboratory, TEI of Thessaly
Sector: Ceramics and Glass, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Product life extension through remanufacturing in Europe
Description: Following the successful completion of the European Remanufacturing Network project funded through Horizon 2020, the Conseil Européen de Remanufacture was launched in January 2017. It has members such as IBM, Lexmark, SKF, Panalpina, syncreon, Autocraft and others who pay annual membership subscriptions to develop, promote and exchange good practise between the remanufacturing sectors.
Sector: B2B services, Repair, Refurbishment, Remanufacture, Repurpose, Research

Title: CEMA’s co-processing to turn cement waste into a resource
Description: Cement and Environment Labour Foundation (CEMA Foundation) was created by Oficemen (Spanish Cement Association) and the two largest trade unions operating in the Spanish cement industry, CCOO de Construcción y Servicios and UGT-FICA, Federación de Industria, Construcción y Agro.
Organisation: Cement and Environment Labour Foundation - CEMA Foundation
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Energy and waste-to-energy, Industrial symbiosis, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Cardyon: reuse of CO2 for polyols production
Description: Covestro has developed an innovative technology that allows using CO2 as raw material for the production of chemical building blocks for high-quality plastics.
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Circular action for climate neutrality, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: Cradle-to-grave recycling process at Mosca GmbH
Description: Mosca's PET strap is made from 100% recycled material: the so-called "bottle flakes" are a result of recycled plastic bottles coming from the empties of discounters.
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Basque Ecodesign Center
Description: The Basque Ecodesign Center (BEdC) is based in the Basque Country and structured as a partnership framework between private firms, the main industrial clusters, and the Basque Government through the public agencies Ihobe and Spri. The objective of the BEdC is to help ensure that the Basque Country is an advanced region in the field of ecodesign and a benchmark throughout the European Union.
Sector: B2B services, Business incubators, Startups, Circular design

Title: 36 Circular Economy Demonstration Projects in the Basque Country
Description: The Circular Economy Demonstration Projects programme was launched in 2014 and has been repeated yearly, having developed 36 projects by 2016.
Organisation: Ihobe, the Environmental Management Public Agency of the Basque Government
Key Area: Consumption, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Awareness raising, B2B services, Business incubators, Startups, Industrial symbiosis

Title: IMPACTPaperRec
Description: Separate collection of paper for recycling will boost the Circular Economy in Europe.
Sector: Recycling, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: LIFE RECYPACK: public-private waste management for commercial plastic packaging
Description: The LIFE RECYPACK project will implement a new public-private waste management project for commercial plastic packages in line with the circular economy criteria.
Sector: Packaging, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Research

Title: No more microplastic fibres in our laundry's waste water!
Description: The PlanetCare Filter is a simple, yet efficient filter for removing microfibrers from washing machine waste water.
Sector: Water

Title: Surplus capacity? Waste it no more: FLOOW2 facilitates B2B Asset Sharing
Description: FLOOW2 is the sharing marketplace solution for every business, organization and network.FLOOW2 works locally and internationally, to identify needs and opportunities of asset sharing for businesses. Sharing assets may be a new concept, but it is an integral part of the development towards a more circular economy in which collaboration is key!
Sector: B2B services, Digital solutions, Product as a Service

Title: Circular economy, a holistic approach towards low-carbon Alpine cities
Description: Cities and regions in Alpine Space have mainly set their low-carbon objectives and adopted relevant strategies in energy, mobility, construction aso. The project GREENCYCLE aims to introduce the system of circular economy as a holistic approach to support implementation of low-carbon strategies and provide additional 2-4 % greenhouse emission reduction to the partner cities.
Sector: Public procurement, Public services, Research

Title: At-home recycling of bioplastics - and all domestic food waste - thanks to the seriously HOT composting bin
Description: The HOTBIN is an innovative hot compost bin that super heats your food and garden waste to 60°c. It can suit not only individual needs, but also the needs of sport clubs, canteens or schools, mixing food waste with biodegradable plastics.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Personal and household goods

Title: Screen-lab: establishing a new reference framework to support H2020/ESIF synergies in Regions
Description: SCREEN is a Horizon 2020 project covering 17 European regions.It aims at defining a replicable systemic approach towards a transition to Circular Economy in EU regions within the context of the Smart Specialization Strategy. It also deals with operational synergies between investments in research and innovation under Horizon 2020, the Structural Funds and the European Investment Funds.
Organisation: 17 European Regions | Coordination: Region of Lazio
Sector: Innovation and investment, Measuring circularity, Research

Title: PolyStyreneLoop project: pioneer demonstration plant to treat up to 3300 tonnes of polystyrene waste/yr as of 2018
Description: The PolyStyreneLoop Cooperative is the European EPS/XPS industry’s closed loop solution for the recycling of polystyrene (PS) insulation foam waste.This project employs a ground-breaking technology to dissolve PS foam waste while also allowing for the extraction and recovery of bromine from the restricted flame retardant chemical, HBCD, which can then be used again in the production.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Innovative bonus-malus system for increased rates of recyclability in the packaging industry, France
Description: Eco-contribution is mandatory in France for the packaging industry, as an incentive for improving recyclability from the start.The Modulated Eco-Contribution Scale is an educational and financial incentive tool promoting the development of eco-design. In order to facilitate maximum recycling of paper fibres, manufacturers must adopt best practices and manage materials so as to preserve quality.
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Governance, Measuring circularity, Packaging

Title: VinylPlus®: the Voluntary Sustainable Development Programme of the European PVC industry
Description: VinylPlus® is the renewed ten-year Voluntary Commitment to Sustainable Development by the European PVC industry. It was developed through dialogue with stakeholders. The scheme delivers concrete results in the use of additives, traceability, collection and recycling.
Key Area: Production, Waste management, Secondary raw materials, Innovation and investments
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber

Title: From waste water to RichWater, an innovative technology for combining treatment and reuse in agriculture
Description: RichWater is a EU Horizon 2020 funded project which has provided an innovative technology for wastewater reuse in agricuture. An integrated approach combining treatment and irrigation in a single system enables taking maximum advantage of nutrients.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Research, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: Do you see a Building... or a Bank of recyclable Materials?
Description: The BAMB project is an innovation action within the EU funded Horizon 2020 program.BAMB will enable a systemic shift where dynamically and flexibly designed buildings can be incorporated into a circular economy. Through design and circular value chains, materials in buildings sustain their value – in a sector producing less waste and using less virgin resources.
Sector: Circular design, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure

Title: Circular is the new black: research program towards a sustainable fashion industry
Description: Leading the way towards a circular fashion industry, the Mistra Future Fashion research program uses the expertise of the entirety of the textile value chain to highlight challenges and solutions to make fashion more sustainable. It publishes reports and peer reviewed articles that focus on how exactly this industry can be made more "circular".
Organisation: MISTRA, Foundation for Strategic Environmental Research
Sector: Clothing and Fashion industry, Research, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Canon toner cartridges recycling programme: closing the loop in 18 countries across Europe
Description: Canon has been providing a toner cartridge recycling programme since 1990 for all Canon genuine all in one laser cartridges (Canon toner cartridges used in i-Sensys type machines). Today the official programme operates in 18 countries across Europe.The programme is free of charge to customers within selected geographies across Europe and has been designed to be easy to use to further encourage recycling, using web based systems where customers can download a free post return label.
Sector: Machinery and Equipment

Title: Different ways of turning wastewater treatment plants into resource recovery facilities
Description: The EU FP7 funded project R3Water “Demonstration of innovative solutions for Reuse of water, Recovery of valuables and Resource efficiency in urban wastewater treatment“ demonstrated solutions to support the transition from being purely a wastewater treatment plant using energy and chemicals, towards a resource facility delivering different valuables.
Sector: Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials, Water

Title: In the city of Almere, innovative waste project turns water plants into paper
Description: The city of Almere, working together with local stakeholders and the company Millvision, has developed an innovative circular economy partnership. The aquatic plant is a local and renewable input to the production of the paper but it also "circular" as something that would be discarded as waste is re-valued as a raw material used in production.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Pulp and Paper Industry (PPI), Recycling, Water

Title: Sharing Materials to Minimize Waste: Industrial Symbiosis Project
Description: SYMBI project will contribute to improve the implementation of regional development policies and programmes related to the promotion and dissemination of Industrial Symbiosis and Circular Economy.
Organisation: Foundation FUNDECYT Scientific and Technological Park of Extremadura
Type of Organisation: Network of local and/or regional authorities
Sector: Industrial symbiosis, Public services, Research

Title: Toolkit for policy makers: circular economy in the re-industrialisation of urban areas
Description: Cities of Making addresses the challenge of re-industrialisation in urban areas, where circular economy will have a key role. The project aims at developping a toolkit for policy makers to promote urban manufacturing in a transition economy.
Sector: Housing and Urban development, Public services, Research

Title: Advanced Dry Recovery (ADR) technology upgrades fine non-ferrous metals from municipal waste-to-energy ash
Description: The Inashco ash recycling consists of an on-site concentrator (ADR) and a centralized upgrading facility. The ADR together with conventional Eddy Current Separators, produce a fine non-ferrous concentrate and a clean marketable mineral aggregate. The non-ferrous concentrate is transported to the Inashco proprietary upgrading facility to be upgraded into metal scrap products.
Sector: Mining, metals and minerals, Recycling, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: From environmental nuisance to secondary raw material: coastal vegetal waste in composites industry
Description: The main objective of SEA-MATTER is to demonstrate and validate the reuse of coastal algae and seaweed accumulations as raw materials in composites industry.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure

Title: Light as a service: green performance economy in Schiphol Airport
Description: In one of its terminals, Schiphol Airport runs the project "Light as a service" whereby it pays for the light produced, while its two partners Philips and Cofely remain the owners of the lamps and fittings.Thanks to this innovative partnership, maintenance costs are reduced and recyclability and reusability of the lighting and framing guaranteed.
Sector: B2B services, Product as a Service

Title: When it comes to recycling aluminium, Every Can Counts
Description: The “Every Can Counts” programme aims to improve recycling by enabling and encouraging people to recycle drinks cans used outside the home (e.g. workplaces, festivals, tourist locations, etc.).
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Empowering Consumers, Mining, metals and minerals

Title: Tackling ocean pollution from simple nets on fishing boats to innovative recycled products
Description: WFO collects and transforms Ocean Plastic by collaborating with fishermen and brands.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Biopolymers from bakery waste: now you can eat your cake and wrap the next cake, too
Description: BREAD4PLA is a project conducted by a consortium of four European organisation led by AIMPLAS.It seeked to demonstrate, in a pre-productive pilot plant process, the viability of poly(lactic acid), a bioplastic polymer (PLA), synthesized from waste products of the bakery industry for the production of bakery packaging.
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Food, water and nutrients, Packaging, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Household organic waste and small plants: door to door collection solves the composting dilemma for inhabitants in Milan
Description: The door to door households organic waste collection plan was first introduced in November 2012 in one quarter of the city of Milan and then was extended to the whole city in June 2014. Collection frequency is twice a week.The aim of the separate collection of food waste is to divert this material from incineration and to send it to AD for production of biogas and good quality compost.
Organisation: AMSA for the Municipality of Milan
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Empowering Consumers, Public services, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Contarina integrated waste management model: 'Door to Door', 'Pay As You Throw'
Description: Contarina’s waste management model success is based on a curbside collection system with a “pay as you throw” fee: a model that has been thoroughly tried and tested. For years, Contarina has been leader in Europe in recycling and is an example of cutting-edge public entity in terms of services and results, working with the community to achieve a common goal: protection of the environment.
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: Three pilot colleges in the Lozere Department eradicate food waste from the menu
Description: At the end of year 2014 the Lozere Department engaged in a territorial plan of waste prevention.Among the different actions, the Department has implemented an action in three pilot colleges to fight food waste in the canteens. The ambitious and transversal program involved actors at all levels in the college: Director, Manager, kitchen team, teachers, students and their parents.
Sector: Education and skills, Food, water and nutrients, Public services

Title: Rolling Plastics: towards precision sorting of plastics components from end-of-life vehicles
Description: Recycling plastic parts from scrapped end-of-life vehicles (ELV) in the Basque Country to obtain high-added-value granules.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Innovation and investment, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: Recover® recycled yarns adress the high environmental pressure of cotton textile production
Description: Hilature Ferre mill has been recycling textile materials since 1947, but it is in 2015 that the company officially launched its Recover Upcycled Textile System for open end high quality recycled yarns.Hilaturas Ferre collects and sorts textile waste resources from all over the planet, cutting and shredding them to produce new fiber to feed their industrial spinning process.
Sector: Recycling, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Green procurement: white aggregates in road resurfacing sparks up incentive for recycling
Description: In Hamburg, green public procurement principles are included in the City's overarching procurement policy. Additional environmental contract requirements are imposed by the City.Hamburg has taken a significant step forward to encourage an increase of recycling rates in construction materials by establishing an online exchange for soil, debris and construction materials.
Sector: Public procurement, Public services

Title: Smart magnetic separation turns any kind of PET plastic into high quality raw material
Description: Ioniqa is a clean-tech-spin-off based in the Netherlands that has developed an innovative process to recycle all types and colours of PET waste into high quality pure raw materialsthat ensures a less impact on scarce resources like oil.
Sector: Industrial techniques, Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recycling

Title: TheCircularLab: a packaging innovation laboratory
Description: In 2017, Ecoembes launched its pioneering circular economy project in Europe, TheCircularLab, which will involve all phases of packaging from creation, via ecodesign, up to the reintroduction of our products into the consumption cycle. TheCircularLab aims to turn the La Rioja region into a great centre for experimentation by enabling innovations to be tested on a real scale.
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Circular design, Empowering Consumers, Packaging

Title: Port of Rotterdam: cyclists can enjoy a like-new bike lane, thanks to a bio-based ‘rejuvenator’ for recycled asphalt
Description: The Port of Rotterdam Authority and the Municipality of Rotterdam in partnership with KWS Infra and Arizona Chemical to deploy recycled asphalt. The processing of rejuvenation utilizes a "rejuvenator" using raw material extracted from pine tree by-products.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Public procurement, Public services, Recycling

Title: Genoa’s municipal pharmacies: collecting unused pharmaceuticals for those who need them
Description: TheFarmacie Comunaliof the city of Genoa, in partnership with theAssociazione Gigi Ghirotti, organises the collection of unused pharmaceuticals to provide for the needs of those who would otherwise struggle to afford them. Through this project, Genoa's eightFarmacie Comunalidistribute these "reused" pharmaceutical products.
Sector: Public services, Social impact

Title: Stroller sharing: busy moms and dads can enjoy easier trips to the shops with Buggybooker
Description: If car sharing could be a success, so could buggy sharing! This thought led to Frank Verheijden championing the idea, and in 2014, Buggybooker started commercially sharing children's buggies.
Sector: Personal and household services, Product as a Service

Title: Visual and near-infrared spectroscopy might revolutionize textile recycling
Description: The research institute IVL has developed a new technology that may revolutionize textile recycling. It consists on sorting effectively clothes or other fabrics based on various types of fibres and it aims to increase efficiency and quality in textile sorting, therefore improving quality  of recycled products.
Sector: Industrial techniques, Recycling, Research, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Recycling batteries now available at your nearest post office (Lithuania)
Description: Lithuania Post is encouraging residents to pay special attention to waste batteries containing hazardous materials (lead, cadmium, mercury etc.) that may contaminate groundwater and damage the environment and human health.
Sector: Chemical management, Empowering Consumers

Title: A new recycling system for work clothes at Posti, Finland
Description: Finland's post office has put in place a new recycling system to collect and separate its employee's valuable and re-usable work clothing that matches the new Posti brand, including mail deliverers’ shell jackets and trousers, winter coats and reflective work clothes.
Sector: Public procurement, Public services, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: Sustainable fish farming and fighting against food waste
Description: The project located in the territory of Thau is an experimental project,carried out by the CPIE* Bassin de Thau with the involvement of different partners, includingCIRAD* for scientific coordination. This project aims to develop anew fishing fieldby experimenting with mule farming and by testing the incorporation of bread from the catering industry into fish pellets.
Sector: Agriculture, fertilisers and forestry, Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Food, water and nutrients

Title: SubsTer® - Transforming quarry tailings into fertile ground
Description: SubsTer can be used to preserve natural spaces and recreate landscaped areas.
Sector: Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Soils, soil improvement and restoration

Title: Cooling servers, cleaning bodies: recycled heat from server room provides hot water in the sports hall showers of the Jean Moulin University, Lyon
Description: Stimergy by using a liquid cooling and heat recovery system in server rooms or by decentralising its servers in "digital boilers" located in residential and public buildings recycles heat from data servers to water heating systems.Thanks to its liquid heat recovery system, Stimergy both reduces energy waste of servers and energy needs of water heating systems.
Sector: Electronics and ICT, Energy and waste-to-energy

Title: Cooperation between Aurubis and Grillo-Werke yields a perfect closed loop for copper and zinc
Description: Aurubis, an expert in multi-metal recycling, and Grillo-Werke, specialised in zinc and sulphur products, cooperate to make a perfect closed loop for non ferrous trace elements.Residual zinc from copper production is used by Grillo-Werke as a secondary raw material for zinc sulfate. Residues from this production - including copper, tin and lead - are then fed back to Aurubis.
Sector: Industrial symbiosis, Mining, metals and minerals

Title: From waste water to biofuels: ECO3 bio- and circular economy business area
Description: An innovative, industrial-scale, multidisciplinary bio- and circular economy business area, ECO3, is being built. A new creative ecosystem has been developed, which exceeds traditional sector boundaries, and in which one person’s waste is another’s commodity. The plant is expected to be fully operational in 2018.
Organisation: ECO3 bio- and circular economy business park
Sector: Bioeconomy and Biomimicry, Industrial symbiosis

Title: Waste to Energy all the ways in the district of Leoben, Austria
Description: In the district of Leoben, about 12 300 tons of municipal waste were buried without any energy recovery until 2003. Since 2004, landfill regulations prescribe a pre-treatment of waste before landfill deposit and a new scheme for waste management with multiple treatment options allowed a reduction of municipal waste to a quarter and the production of heat and electricity for local use.
Organisation: Waste management board - district of Leoben, Austria
Sector: Power and utilities, Public services, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: INDRA, a competitive end-of-life vehicles treatment branch, recuperates up to 95% of car mass
Description: Renault and Suez(formely Sita France), through their joint-venture INDRA have created a competitive end-of-life vehicle treatment program which is comprised of a network of 350 end of life (EVL) dismantlers. In 2016 recovered 355 000 end of life vehicles.
Sector: Batteries and Vehicles, Mining, metals and minerals, Recycling

Title: Offer and demand in secondary raw materials? Make the perfect match on MarketplaceHub
Description: Marketplace Hub maps raw materials markets and industrial synergy networks worldwide by both their locations and what material they trade. It aims to aid interested businesses to find where they could source or sell their materials secondary raw materials.Best practices, policies, and lessons learned are also included in the interactive web-based platform.
Sector: Digital solutions, Industrial symbiosis, Waste management & Secondary Raw Materials

Title: The functional economy in the chemical industry: 8 case studies demonstrate efficiency and sustainability
Description: Take Back Chemicalsis innovating by proposing a 'functional economy' business model in the use of chemicals. Traditional business models are based on sales per volume, whereas TBC uses "chemical leasing" and regeneration process for greater efficiency and sustainability.The report is based on the study of 3 cases in Belgium and 5 cases in the Netherlands with leading chemical industries.
Sector: B2B services, Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Product as a Service

Title: Electric and electronic waste: a little incentive goes a long way
Description: Binee is a local recycling service to dispose of outdated electric and electronic appliances, gaining success by its understanding of consumers' expectations and behaviours. A right mix between convenience, digital tracking, transparency and reward system makes it an efficient approach to maximise 'Urban mining' in EEEW.
Sector: Behavioural incentives, Electronics and ICT, Empowering Consumers

Title: Relight - Collection, Recycling and WEEE Treatment
Description: Accurate and timely collection of WEEE, high standards in the treatment thereof and effective recovery of materials from it.
Sector: Electronics and ICT, Empowering Consumers, Personal and household goods, Recycling

Title: Meet Econyl®, the high quality regenerated nylon yarn
Description: Used nylons, mainly from the fishing industry, are gathered, reprocessed and turned into an innovative ecological nylon material, called econyl. They are afterwards sold for further use.
Sector: Plastics, Polymers and Rubber, Recover, Regenerative economy, Textiles, apparel and leather

Title: GtoG: let's change the way gypsum based waste are treated
Description: The GtoG project has put in place an integrated approach to construction and demolition waste by holistic management, starting from the major refurbishment/demolition sites to the reincorporation of the recycled gypsum in the manufacturing process via the processing of gypsum waste as a secondary raw material
Sector: Cement, Steel, Chemicals, Construction, Buildings and Infrastructure, Research

Title: Digging gold from trash: ProSUM, a centralised database for critical secondary raw materials
Description: Until now, the data on CRMs has been produced by a variety of actors and lies scattered in different databases, formats and reports which makes it difficult to compare or aggregate. The ProSUM project aims at producing the EU Urban Mine Knowledge Data Platform (EU-UMKDP) providing user friendly, seamless access to data and intelligence on mineral resources from extraction to end of life products.
Sector: Digital solutions, Mining, metals and minerals, Recycling, Research
